Litigation Professional.name: Holding Clarity and Specificity
Litigation Professional.description: Evaluates how clearly and precisely the summary states the case's holding(s), including whether each holding is articulated in outcome-oriented terms and tied to identified issues.

sub_criteria.name: Issue-by-Issue Holdings
sub_criteria.description: Holdings are separated, labeled, and aligned to discrete, named legal issues.

sub_criteria.name: Outcome Language Precision
sub_criteria.description: Use of definitive, unambiguous outcome terms (e.g., 'holding that', 'reversing', 'adopting') rather than vague descriptions.

sub_criteria.name: Scope and Conditions Disclosure
sub_criteria.description: Clarity about the holding's scope, conditions, exceptions, or limiting context (e.g., fact-bound, narrow rule) as stated in the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Negative/Alternative Holdings Coverage
sub_criteria.description: Explicitly notes issues or arguments rejected, alternative holdings, or dicta when relevant to application by end users, as reflected in the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Cross-Reference to Framed Issues
sub_criteria.description: Each holding is cross-referenced or directly tied to a clearly framed question presented or issue statement in the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Liability vs. Remedy Distinction
sub_criteria.description: Holdings clearly distinguish between liability/merits determinations and remedies/relief determinations where both are present in the case summary.

sub_criteria.name: Operative Rule Language Extraction
sub_criteria.description: Includes or paraphrases the operative sentence(s) that express the holding in a rule-like, reusable form suitable for briefs and analogizing, as available in the summary text.

Litigation Professional.name: Procedural History and Posture Clarity
Litigation Professional.description: Assesses whether the procedural posture and history are presented in a chronological, comprehensible sequence with sufficient details and dates to understand how the case reached the decision.

sub_criteria.name: Stage Coverage
sub_criteria.description: Coverage of key stages (filing, dispositive motions, trial/verdict, appeal(s), remand) relevant to understanding posture at decision time.

sub_criteria.name: Motion-Level Detail
sub_criteria.description: Identification of motion types and rulings (e.g., 12(b)(6), summary judgment), including outcomes at each stage where relevant to the decision context.

sub_criteria.name: Chronological Coherence
sub_criteria.description: Logical ordering of events without gaps or contradictions; clear temporal sequence is maintained throughout the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Decision-Time Posture Clarity
sub_criteria.description: The posture at the time of the appellate or final decision is explicitly stated (e.g., appeal from grant of summary judgment, interlocutory appeal).

sub_criteria.name: Prior Court Outcomes Clarity
sub_criteria.description: Outcomes and rationales at earlier stages (e.g., trial court, administrative body) are summarized to the extent necessary for understanding the decision's context.

sub_criteria.name: Key Dates Inclusion
sub_criteria.description: Includes decision date and dates for key procedural milestones when provided in the summary, anchoring the chronology and posture analysis.

sub_criteria.name: Jurisdictional Basis Identification
sub_criteria.description: States the jurisdictional basis (e.g., federal question, diversity, removal) and any jurisdictional rulings relevant to posture, where indicated in the summary text.

sub_criteria.name: Issue Preservation/Timeliness
sub_criteria.description: Notes preservation of issues, waiver, or timeliness rulings that affect what was reviewable on appeal, as reflected in the summary content.

Litigation Professional.name: Disposition Mapping by Issue and Party
Litigation Professional.description: Measures how explicitly the summary states the final disposition(s) (e.g., affirmed, reversed, vacated, remanded, dismissed) and maps them to specific issues and parties/claims.

sub_criteria.name: Issue-Level Dispositions
sub_criteria.description: Outcome specified per legal issue or claim rather than using a single global result only.

sub_criteria.name: Party-Level Outcomes
sub_criteria.description: Outcomes identified by party (e.g., plaintiff vs. defendant, individual defendants) where relevant and distinguishable in the case posture.

sub_criteria.name: Mixed Outcomes Explicitness
sub_criteria.description: Clarity when outcomes vary by issue or party (e.g., affirmed in part, reversed in part), including precise mapping across combinations of claims and parties.

sub_criteria.name: Remand Instructions Mapping
sub_criteria.description: Specific remand instructions and their target issues/claims are identified and clearly associated with the relevant parties and stages.

sub_criteria.name: Finality and With/Without Prejudice
sub_criteria.description: Indicates whether dispositions are final or interlocutory and whether dismissals are with or without prejudice when the summary provides that information.

sub_criteria.name: Mandate and Next Steps Clarity
sub_criteria.description: Describes the appellate mandate's practical effect and any required next steps by the lower court or parties, where the summary provides such detail.

Litigation Professional.name: Standard of Review Identification and Linkage
Litigation Professional.description: Evaluates whether the summary states the standard(s) of review and links each to the corresponding issue or ruling (e.g., de novo, abuse of discretion, clear error).

sub_criteria.name: Presence of Standards
sub_criteria.description: Explicit identification of the standard(s) of review applied by the court for the relevant issues or rulings.

sub_criteria.name: Issue-Standard Alignment
sub_criteria.description: Clear mapping of each named standard to the specific issue(s) or ruling(s) it governs; avoids general, untethered statements of standards.

sub_criteria.name: Terminology Accuracy
sub_criteria.description: Correct use of standard-of-review terminology (e.g., distinguishes de novo vs. clear error; recognizes mixed questions) as reflected in the summary text.

sub_criteria.name: Record View Articulation
sub_criteria.description: States how evidence is viewed under the applicable standard (e.g., inferences in favor of non-movant on summary judgment) when the summary provides that detail.

sub_criteria.name: Sourcing and Pin Cites
sub_criteria.description: Where provided in the summary, inclusion of citations or pin cites supporting the articulated standard(s) of review for brief-readiness.

sub_criteria.name: Multiple Standards Coordination
sub_criteria.description: Explains how different standards apply to different questions (e.g., legal vs. factual vs. mixed) within the same appeal, avoiding confusion across issues as stated in the summary content.

sub_criteria.name: Harmless Error/Prejudice Articulation
sub_criteria.description: Notes any harmless-error or prejudice standards and their application, where the summary indicates such analysis by the court.

Litigation Professional.name: Legal Issues Framing
Litigation Professional.description: Assesses whether the legal questions are clearly framed, scoped, and stated in a manner that supports motion and brief drafting (e.g., concise, answerable questions).

sub_criteria.name: Question Format and Answerability
sub_criteria.description: Issues stated as concise, answerable questions or clear propositions that align with how courts frame and resolve issues.

sub_criteria.name: Scope Precision and Non-Overlap
sub_criteria.description: Each issue is scoped narrowly enough to be answerable and avoids overlapping with other issues in a way that causes redundancy or confusion.

sub_criteria.name: Practical Relevance for Drafting
sub_criteria.description: Issues framed to support typical litigation tasks (e.g., dispositive motions, evidentiary disputes) as suggested by the summary's context and content.

sub_criteria.name: Clarity of Answer Signposting
sub_criteria.description: For each framed issue, the summary signals or articulates the corresponding answer or outcome direction to guide users effectively.

sub_criteria.name: Issue Hierarchy and Sequencing
sub_criteria.description: Distinguishes primary from subsidiary issues and orders them logically to mirror the court’s resolution path as reflected in the summary text.

sub_criteria.name: Open Questions and Ambiguities
sub_criteria.description: Flags unresolved questions, splits, or ambiguities the court left open, where indicated by the summary, to inform end-user strategy and expectations.

Litigation Professional.name: Rule Statements and Elements Precision
Litigation Professional.description: Evaluates how precisely the summary articulates governing rules, including elements, factors, or tests, and any exceptions or defenses relevant to the holding.

sub_criteria.name: Elements/Factors Listing
sub_criteria.description: Completeness and clarity in listing elements or factors of the rule/test, including sequencing and any required mental states or thresholds as reflected in the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Exceptions/Limitations
sub_criteria.description: Identification of exceptions, limitations, defenses, or safe harbors relevant to practical application as indicated in the summary text.

sub_criteria.name: Burden of Proof/Production
sub_criteria.description: Explicit statements regarding which party bears which burden (proof/production/persuasion) for the relevant elements or defenses as shown in the summary content.

sub_criteria.name: Factor Weights and Tests
sub_criteria.description: Clarifies whether factors are weighted, required, or part of a balancing test, and any threshold/standard for satisfaction mentioned in the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Rule Source Attribution
sub_criteria.description: Provides citations or attribution to the rule's source (statute, precedent) when present in the summary to support brief-readiness and verification.

sub_criteria.name: Temporal/Retroactivity Clarification
sub_criteria.description: States whether the rule applies retroactively, prospectively, or under specific temporal constraints where indicated by the summary text.

sub_criteria.name: Jurisdictional Variants and Splits
sub_criteria.description: Notes circuit/state splits or jurisdiction-specific variations in the rule that affect transferability, as stated or implied in the summary’s content.

sub_criteria.name: Policy Rationale Linkage
sub_criteria.description: Connects the rule to any articulated policy or rationale that may guide application or advocacy, if provided in the summary’s description of the court’s reasoning.

Litigation Professional.name: Material Facts Relevance
Litigation Professional.description: Measures whether the summary includes the minimally necessary and legally material facts that illuminate application of the rule/holding, avoiding extraneous narrative detail.

sub_criteria.name: Materiality and Sufficiency
sub_criteria.description: Includes facts that are outcome-determinative or necessary to understand the holding; omits immaterial details unless needed for context per the summary's scope.

sub_criteria.name: Fact-to-Rule Linkage
sub_criteria.description: Explicitly ties facts to specific rule elements or holdings to demonstrate how the court applied the law, as represented in the summary text.

sub_criteria.name: Distinguishing Facts Highlighted
sub_criteria.description: Identifies salient facts that limit or distinguish the case for future use (e.g., unique circumstances) where indicated by the summary content.

sub_criteria.name: Exclusion of Extraneous Detail
sub_criteria.description: Avoids unnecessary narrative; achieves a lean facts section focused on material points supporting the legal analysis, given the summary's purpose and audience.

sub_criteria.name: Procedural vs. Merits Facts Separation
sub_criteria.description: Separately presents procedural facts (e.g., filings, rulings) and merits facts (events/transactions) to improve clarity and application, where feasible in the summary’s scope.

sub_criteria.name: Record Citation or Source Cues
sub_criteria.description: Includes references to the record or source cues for key facts (e.g., 'as alleged in the complaint') when provided by the summary, aiding reliability assessments.

Litigation Professional.name: Case Identification and Citation Readiness
Litigation Professional.description: Assesses whether the summary provides complete case identification and brief-ready citation details, including court, jurisdiction, decision date, and pin cites, as available within the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Full Case Citation Presence
sub_criteria.description: Includes party names, reporter volume, reporter, first page, court, year, and/or neutral citation as available; formatting recognizable for briefing purposes.

sub_criteria.name: Court Identification
sub_criteria.description: Correctly identifies the deciding court and its level (e.g., Supreme Court, Circuit, District, State appellate) as available in the summary text.

sub_criteria.name: Jurisdiction Clarity
sub_criteria.description: States the geographic and/or subject-matter jurisdiction relevant to the decision as presented in the summary, aiding applicability assessments.

sub_criteria.name: Precedential/Publication Status
sub_criteria.description: Indicates whether the opinion is published, unpublished, or non-precedential if the summary provides such cues, and characterizes implications when stated.

sub_criteria.name: Decision Date Presence
sub_criteria.description: Clearly states the decision date if provided in the summary, enabling recency assessments by users.

sub_criteria.name: Docket/Case Number
sub_criteria.description: Inclusion of docket or case number if provided in the summary for identification and retrieval purposes.

sub_criteria.name: Pinpoint Citations
sub_criteria.description: Presence of page or paragraph pin cites tied to holdings, rules, or quotations where available in the provided content.

sub_criteria.name: Short-Form Readiness
sub_criteria.description: Provides, or makes clear, a short-form citation basis (case name and pinpoint) to support repeated references in briefs if feasible from the summary's content.

sub_criteria.name: Parallel/Neutral Citation Inclusion
sub_criteria.description: Includes parallel or neutral citations where pertinent and provided in the summary, aiding cross-database retrieval and jurisdictional preferences.

sub_criteria.name: Parties and Case Caption Clarity
sub_criteria.description: Party names are presented clearly and consistently; the caption or case style is recognizable for search and citation purposes, as shown in the summary content.

sub_criteria.name: Subject-Matter Tags or Keywords (if provided)
sub_criteria.description: Includes subject-matter descriptors or keywords that match the issues/rules to aid discoverability and end-user filtering, where the summary provides them.

sub_criteria.name: Statutes/Regulations at Issue
sub_criteria.description: Lists key statutes or regulations implicated, with citations if provided in the summary, supporting research and applicability assessments by end users.

sub_criteria.name: Authoring Judge/Panel Identification
sub_criteria.description: Identifies the authoring judge and panel composition where provided, aiding predictive value and familiarity with judicial voice and approach for end users.

Litigation Professional.name: Subsequent History and Treatment (as Stated)
Litigation Professional.description: Assesses inclusion and clarity of any subsequent history or noted treatment that the summary itself reports (e.g., rehearing denied, cert denied, overruled on other grounds).

sub_criteria.name: History Chain Completeness
sub_criteria.description: Captures the sequence of subsequent events mentioned in the summary (e.g., rehearing, en banc, certiorari, remand outcomes) in correct order and scope.

sub_criteria.name: Treatment Characterization Accuracy
sub_criteria.description: Accurately characterizes the effect of subsequent treatment (e.g., distinguished, followed, overruled on other grounds) as reflected in the summary's content.

sub_criteria.name: Dates and Citations of Subsequent Events
sub_criteria.description: Includes dates and citations for major subsequent history events where provided by the summary for traceability and currency assessment.

sub_criteria.name: Impact on Precedential Weight
sub_criteria.description: Explains (when stated in the summary) whether subsequent treatment alters the case's weight or applicability for end-user use cases.

sub_criteria.name: Negative Treatment Warning
sub_criteria.description: Flags negative subsequent treatment (e.g., criticized, questioned, abrogated) as noted in the summary and clarifies the dimension (rule, holding, dicta) affected if stated, aiding risk-aware use by end users.

Litigation Professional.name: Remedies and Relief Specificity
Litigation Professional.description: Measures the detail with which the summary describes relief ordered or denied (e.g., damages, injunctions, fees) and any remand instructions, as stated in the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Relief Type Identification
sub_criteria.description: Identifies the type(s) of relief addressed (e.g., damages categories, equitable relief, declaratory relief) consistent with the summary's content and scope.

sub_criteria.name: Quantification and Terms
sub_criteria.description: Provides amounts, scope, duration, or key terms/conditions of relief when available from the summary for practical application in drafting and negotiation contexts.

sub_criteria.name: Ancillary Orders and Fees
sub_criteria.description: Notes fee shifting, costs, sanctions, interest, or compliance orders if present in the summary, including bases for such awards when indicated.

sub_criteria.name: Remand Instructions Detail
sub_criteria.description: Specifies any remand directions (e.g., fact-finding scope, standards on remand) as described in the summary, aiding implementation by end users.

sub_criteria.name: Enforcement/Compliance Mechanics
sub_criteria.description: Describes enforcement mechanisms (e.g., injunction compliance monitoring, deadlines, reporting) or practical compliance steps where the summary provides such detail, supporting real-world implementation by end users.

Litigation Professional.name: Quotable Language Availability and Attribution
Litigation Professional.description: Evaluates whether the summary includes targeted, brief-ready quotations or near-verbatim language for rules/holdings with clear attribution and pin cites where provided.

sub_criteria.name: Rule/Standard Quotations
sub_criteria.description: Presence of concise quotations or near-verbatim language capturing rules or standards useful in briefs, with attribution if provided in the summary text.

sub_criteria.name: Holding/Disposition Quotations
sub_criteria.description: Quotable language that captures the holding or disposition precisely, with pin cites if present in the summary to support accurate citation in briefs.

sub_criteria.name: Attribution and Pinpoint Clarity
sub_criteria.description: Each quotation is clearly attributed to the correct source with page/paragraph references when provided by the summary for verification and reuse.

sub_criteria.name: Quote Integrity
sub_criteria.description: Quoted material is accurate, faithful to the source, and not misleadingly excerpted, as can be assessed from the summary's provided information.

sub_criteria.name: Brevity and Snippet Usability
sub_criteria.description: Quotes are concise (e.g., sentence-length) and readily reusable in briefs or memos without heavy editing, as reflected in the summary’s provided content.

Litigation Professional.name: Authority Integration with Parentheticals
Litigation Professional.description: Assesses how the summary presents other authorities it references (if any), including brief parentheticals that explain relevance or key propositions, as shown within the summary itself.

sub_criteria.name: Relevance Parentheticals
sub_criteria.description: Parentheticals concisely explain the cited authority's key proposition, relevance, or distinguishing point as presented in the summary content.

sub_criteria.name: Signal Usage Accuracy
sub_criteria.description: Accurate use or description of citation signals (e.g., see, cf., accord) in line with common legal writing conventions, if the summary reflects such usage.

sub_criteria.name: Breadth and Balance of Authorities
sub_criteria.description: Referenced authorities (when present) are balanced (supportive and adverse) and appropriately scoped to the summary's purpose and end-user needs as indicated by the content provided.

sub_criteria.name: Integration into Reasoning
sub_criteria.description: Other authorities are integrated into the reasoning flow (as reflected in the summary) rather than listed without context, supporting user understanding and re-use.

sub_criteria.name: Distinguishing Rationale Clarity
sub_criteria.description: When adverse authority is discussed, the summary clearly states the distinguishing rationale or limitation used by the court, aiding advocacy planning by end users.

Litigation Professional.name: Organizational Structure and Navigability
Litigation Professional.description: Evaluates use of clear sections and formatting that facilitate quick lookup (e.g., Facts, Issues, Rule, Holding, Reasoning, Procedural History, Disposition) and overall navigability for drafting.

sub_criteria.name: Sectioning and Headings
sub_criteria.description: Presence of labeled sections that align with litigation drafting needs (e.g., Issues, Holding, Standard of Review, Procedural History) and match content accurately.

sub_criteria.name: Scanning Efficiency
sub_criteria.description: Use of bullets, concise sentences, and consistent formatting enabling rapid extraction of needed information by busy practitioners and other end users.

sub_criteria.name: Cross-Referencing and Anchors
sub_criteria.description: Use of numbering, labels, or cross-references so users can navigate between related sections (e.g., linking an issue to the corresponding holding and standard).

sub_criteria.name: Consistency of Formatting
sub_criteria.description: Uniform headings, typography, and section order that reduce cognitive load and facilitate reuse in drafting workflows, as evident from the summary structure.

sub_criteria.name: Timelines/Visual Aids (if any)
sub_criteria.description: Includes, or makes clear, timelines or visual aids (e.g., bullets, tables) that enhance navigability and understanding when provided in the summary content.

sub_criteria.name: Export/Reuse Readiness
sub_criteria.description: Formatting facilitates copy-paste and reuse (clean bullets, consistent numbering, minimal embedded artifacts) for downstream drafting by end users.

Litigation Professional.name: Neutrality and Objectivity of Tone
Litigation Professional.description: Assesses whether the summary maintains a neutral, non-advocacy tone, avoiding argumentative or outcome-driven language that could mislead or bias drafting choices.

sub_criteria.name: Argumentative Language Avoidance
sub_criteria.description: Avoids persuasive framing and conclusory adjectives that overstate holdings or disparage parties beyond what the summary states as factual/legal outcomes.

sub_criteria.name: Balance of Perspectives
sub_criteria.description: Where relevant in the summary, fairly presents both sides' key positions or the court’s treatment of them without advocacy-laden selection or emphasis.

sub_criteria.name: Speculation and Hedging Discipline
sub_criteria.description: Avoids speculation; uses appropriate qualifiers (e.g., 'the court noted') only when warranted by the summary content and avoids implying holdings not stated.

sub_criteria.name: Editorialization Boundary
sub_criteria.description: Separates neutral summary from commentary; any explanatory gloss is clearly identified as such, where present in the summary’s scope and style guidelines.

Litigation Professional.name: Practical Applicability and Limitations
Litigation Professional.description: Evaluates whether the summary identifies practical constraints on the holding's use drawn from the summary itself (e.g., narrow tailoring, fact-bound nature, limiting principles, burdens), aiding motion/brief strategy.

sub_criteria.name: Limiting Principles and Scope
sub_criteria.description: Identifies conditions and boundaries on applicability (e.g., fact-bound, jurisdiction-specific) as presented in the summary to guide real-world use by various user types.

sub_criteria.name: Generalizability vs. Fact-Boundness
sub_criteria.description: Signals whether the decision articulates broadly applicable rules or is tightly bound to its facts as indicated by the summary, helping users assess transferability.

sub_criteria.name: Jurisdictional Transferability
sub_criteria.description: Notes whether the authority is controlling or persuasive in other jurisdictions and any inter- or intra-jurisdictional nuances stated in the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Strategic Takeaways
sub_criteria.description: Provides actionable insights or cautions (e.g., pleading pointers, evidentiary burdens) grounded in the summary’s content and intended user needs.

sub_criteria.name: Risk Flags and Caveats
sub_criteria.description: Highlights risks such as negative subsequent treatment, circuit splits, or unresolved questions when mentioned in the summary, aiding informed use by end users.

sub_criteria.name: Temporal Applicability
sub_criteria.description: Indicates time-sensitive aspects (e.g., statutes of limitation, accrual rules, retroactivity) relevant to whether and how the holding can be used, where the summary provides such cues.

sub_criteria.name: Posture Replicability
sub_criteria.description: Clarifies whether the decision’s posture (e.g., motion to dismiss vs. post-trial) is central to its applicability and what must be replicated to use the case effectively, as indicated by the summary content.

Litigation Professional.name: Internal Coherence and Consistency
Litigation Professional.description: Evaluates internal consistency across sections (e.g., disposition aligns with holdings; procedural history aligns with outcomes) and consistent use of party names and defined terms within the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Outcome Alignment Across Sections
sub_criteria.description: Holdings, reasoning, and dispositions are mutually consistent; no contradictions across sections based on the summary’s content.

sub_criteria.name: Terminology and Defined Terms Consistency
sub_criteria.description: Party names, claim labels, abbreviations, and defined terms are used consistently throughout the summary to avoid confusion for end users.

sub_criteria.name: Procedural-Factual-Legal Harmony
sub_criteria.description: Facts, procedural posture, and legal analysis sections fit together without gaps or internal tension that would impair user understanding or reuse.

sub_criteria.name: Accuracy of Cross-References
sub_criteria.description: Section cross-references (e.g., to standards or holdings) are correct and lead to the intended content where such references are present in the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Numerical/Quantitative Consistency
sub_criteria.description: Amounts, dates, and counts (e.g., damages, number of issues/claims) are used consistently across sections, avoiding confusion for end users relying on specific figures or timelines.

Litigation Professional.name: Conciseness–Completeness Balance
Litigation Professional.description: Assesses whether the summary is concise yet sufficiently complete to serve drafting needs without omitting core holdings, standards, or procedural details needed for use.

sub_criteria.name: Coverage of Core Components
sub_criteria.description: Includes the essentials: issues, holdings, key rules/standards, material facts, disposition, and citations, as applicable to the summary’s scope and user needs.

sub_criteria.name: Signal-to-Noise Ratio
sub_criteria.description: Minimizes extraneous detail while preserving all information necessary for practical use by target users; high information density without clutter.

sub_criteria.name: Length vs. Complexity Fit
sub_criteria.description: Length and depth are proportional to the case’s complexity and the end-users’ use case as implied by the summary’s context (neither overlong nor skeletal).

sub_criteria.name: Prioritization and Ordering
sub_criteria.description: Places the most actionable and frequently used information early and in predictable locations to accelerate drafting workflows for end users.

sub_criteria.name: Redundancy Control
sub_criteria.description: Avoids repeating the same proposition or fact across sections unless functional (e.g., cross-referenced summaries), keeping the content lean for end-user efficiency.

Litigation Professional.name: Reasoning and Rationale Clarity
Litigation Professional.description: Evaluates how well the summary captures the court’s reasoning path, including key analytic steps and how facts are applied to law.

sub_criteria.name: Logical Flow of Analysis
sub_criteria.description: Presents the court’s analytical sequence clearly (issue identification, rule articulation, application, conclusion) as reflected by the summary’s content.

sub_criteria.name: Conflict/Counterargument Handling
sub_criteria.description: Notes how the court addressed competing authorities or arguments where such handling is stated in the summary, aiding predictive use and briefing strategy.

sub_criteria.name: Application of Facts to Elements
sub_criteria.description: Explains the mapping between material facts and each element/factor in dispute, helping users understand transferability and analogize or distinguish cases.

sub_criteria.name: Policy vs. Precedent Signposting
sub_criteria.description: Identifies whether the reasoning rests primarily on text/precedent, policy considerations, or both, aiding strategic framing for different end users, where the summary provides such cues.

Litigation Professional.name: Dissenting/Concurring Opinions Handling
Litigation Professional.description: Assesses whether the summary addresses separate opinions when they meaningfully affect understanding, weight, or application of the case.

sub_criteria.name: Presence and Identification
sub_criteria.description: Notes existence of concurrences or dissents and identifies author(s) where provided in the summary content.

sub_criteria.name: Substantive Points Extracted
sub_criteria.description: Captures key legal divergences or doctrinal signals from separate opinions that matter for future use as reflected in the summary, if present.

sub_criteria.name: Impact on Precedential Understanding
sub_criteria.description: Explains whether separate opinions affect how the majority should be read or limited, where indicated by the summary’s content.

sub_criteria.name: Vote Split and Joins
sub_criteria.description: States vote count and notable joins/partial joins where provided, signaling strength and scope of consensus relevant to end-user reliance decisions.

Litigation Professional.name: Target User Fit and Use-Case Alignment
Litigation Professional.description: Evaluates how well the summary is tailored to its intended audience(s) and use cases (e.g., practitioners, students, clients), emphasizing utility for end users.

sub_criteria.name: Audience Appropriateness
sub_criteria.description: Language level, context, and detail align with the stated or apparent target user group(s) and their typical tasks as inferred from the summary’s presentation and content cues.

sub_criteria.name: Jargon Management and Explanations
sub_criteria.description: Minimizes unexplained jargon or provides brief definitions/parentheticals where needed for the target user’s background as indicated in the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Use-Case Alignment
sub_criteria.description: Content emphasizes information most useful to expected tasks (e.g., drafting motions, compliance, client counseling) given the summary’s contextual cues and scope.

sub_criteria.name: Actionable Takeaways
sub_criteria.description: Provides clear, actionable insights or 'so what' statements that an end user can directly adapt or apply in their context, consistent with the summary’s neutrality and scope.

sub_criteria.name: Practitioner Utility
sub_criteria.description: Emphasizes brief-ready components (pin cites, standards, issue-holding mapping) and drafting aids for litigators and in-house counsel, as reflected in the summary’s content and structure.

sub_criteria.name: Student/Academic Utility
sub_criteria.description: Provides pedagogically useful structure (clear posture, issue framing, rule/analysis breakdown) and context cues for study and doctrinal synthesis where appropriate to the summary’s purpose.

sub_criteria.name: Client/Non-Lawyer Utility
sub_criteria.description: Includes plain-language explanations or high-level implications for non-lawyers (if relevant to the intended audience) without sacrificing legal accuracy, as reflected in the summary’s cues and scope.

Litigation Professional.name: Accuracy and Faithfulness to Source
Litigation Professional.description: Evaluates whether the summary accurately reflects the case’s facts, holdings, rules, and citations as can be assessed from the information included in the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Factual Accuracy
sub_criteria.description: No material misstatements or distortions of the case’s facts as represented in the summary’s content; internal details are faithful and precise to the extent stated.

sub_criteria.name: Legal Accuracy
sub_criteria.description: Holdings, rules, and standards are accurately characterized without overgeneralization or omission of qualifying language as reflected in the summary text.

sub_criteria.name: Citation Accuracy
sub_criteria.description: Case citations and pin cites included in the summary are correctly formatted and correspond to the propositions they are attached to, where verifiable from the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Quotation Fidelity
sub_criteria.description: Quoted or near-verbatim language (if any) is faithful, accurately attributed, and not taken out of context as can be assessed from the summary’s provided detail.

sub_criteria.name: Rule Element/Factor Count Accuracy
sub_criteria.description: When listing elements or factors, the count and content match the source as represented in the summary; no element is omitted or added improperly to the rule statement in the summary context.

Litigation Professional.name: Digital and Machine-Readiness
Litigation Professional.description: Assesses whether the summary includes structured, machine-usable elements that enhance search, filtering, linking, and workflow integration for end users in digital environments.

sub_criteria.name: Structured Fields Completeness
sub_criteria.description: Presence of structured metadata fields (e.g., case name, court, year, jurisdiction, disposition, issues, standards) suitable for indexing and filtering, as available in the summary format.

sub_criteria.name: Consistent Identifiers/Anchors
sub_criteria.description: Use of consistent IDs, numbering, or anchors for sections/issues enabling cross-references and deep linking within tools, where the summary provides such structure.

sub_criteria.name: Linkability and Source Access
sub_criteria.description: Includes links or clear references enabling navigation to the full opinion, related authorities, or dockets if provided in the summary, supporting verification and further research by end users.

sub_criteria.name: Tagging and Keyword Quality
sub_criteria.description: Quality and specificity of tags/keywords align with legal taxonomies and user search behavior as reflected in the summary’s descriptors, aiding discoverability and filtering.

Litigation Professional.name: Currency and Update Signals (as Stated)
Litigation Professional.description: Evaluates signals within the summary about its currency and updates, enabling end users to assess whether the content reflects recent developments.

sub_criteria.name: Versioning/Last Updated
sub_criteria.description: States a revision or 'last updated' indicator or otherwise signals the recency of the summary itself, where provided in the summary context or metadata.

sub_criteria.name: Recent Developments Noted
sub_criteria.description: Identifies recent related developments (e.g., pending rehearing, newly issued related decisions) as stated in the summary, aiding timeliness assessments by end users.

sub_criteria.name: Time-Sensitive Law Flags
sub_criteria.description: Flags time-sensitive legal contexts (e.g., statutory amendments, sunset provisions) where the summary notes them, helping users avoid stale reliance.

Litigation Professional.name: Comparative and Trend Context (as Stated)
Litigation Professional.description: Assesses whether the summary situates the decision within broader doctrinal or jurisdictional trends when the summary itself provides such context, aiding strategic use.

sub_criteria.name: Doctrinal Trend Signals
sub_criteria.description: Notes trends (e.g., tightening or relaxing standards) or movement in the law as reflected in the summary’s description of the case’s place in the doctrine, if provided.

sub_criteria.name: Inter-/Intra-Jurisdictional Alignment
sub_criteria.description: Explains how the case aligns or conflicts with other jurisdictions or panels (e.g., circuit splits) where the summary notes such comparisons, informing end-user transferability judgments.

sub_criteria.name: Line-of-Cases Placement
sub_criteria.description: Identifies whether the case extends, limits, or reconciles prior precedent as stated in the summary, aiding predictive and analogical use by practitioners and students alike.

Legal Education Community.name: Coverage of Core Case Elements
Legal Education Community.description: Evaluates whether the summary includes and clearly presents the essential components students must learn: material facts, procedural posture, issues, rules, holding, reasoning, disposition, and any remedies.

sub_criteria.name: Material Facts Coverage
sub_criteria.description: Extent to which the summary captures legally relevant facts and omits immaterial details.

sub_criteria.name: Procedural Posture Clarity
sub_criteria.description: Clarity about how the case arrived at the current court (motions, appeals, posture) and what is being reviewed.

sub_criteria.name: Issue Identification
sub_criteria.description: Precision in stating the legal questions presented, framed in answerable terms.

sub_criteria.name: Rule Statement Presence and Clarity
sub_criteria.description: Presence of governing legal rules relevant to the issues and their clear articulation within the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Holding Statement Precision
sub_criteria.description: Specificity and clarity in stating the court’s answer to the legal issue(s).

sub_criteria.name: Reasoning/Analysis Summary
sub_criteria.description: Quality of the explanation of the court's rationale leading from rule and facts to the holding.

sub_criteria.name: Disposition/Outcome Stated
sub_criteria.description: Whether the final procedural outcome (affirmed, reversed, remanded, etc.) is clearly stated.

sub_criteria.name: Remedies/Damages Specified (if applicable)
sub_criteria.description: Whether any remedies, relief, or damages awarded/denied are identified within the summary when relevant.

Legal Education Community.name: Rule Articulation and Structure
Legal Education Community.description: Evaluates how clearly and usefully rules are expressed for teaching: as elements/factors/tests, with standards, exceptions, and definitions.

sub_criteria.name: Elements/Factors/Test Enumerated
sub_criteria.description: Whether the rule is broken into elements or factors suitable for student checklists and analysis.

sub_criteria.name: Standards of Review Identified (if applicable)
sub_criteria.description: Clarity in stating any standard of review or burden applicable as described in the summary (e.g., de novo, abuse of discretion).

sub_criteria.name: Exceptions/Limitations Clearly Stated
sub_criteria.description: Identification of exceptions, defenses, or limiting conditions attached to the rule within the summary itself.

sub_criteria.name: Definitions of Key Terms Provided
sub_criteria.description: Provision of concise definitions for specialized terms used in the rule statements when needed for comprehension.

sub_criteria.name: Conditions for Rule Application Stated
sub_criteria.description: Clarity about when and how the rule applies, including thresholds or prerequisites stated in the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Distinguishes Competing Rules/Approaches (if mentioned)
sub_criteria.description: If the summary notes alternative formulations or jurisdictional splits, clarity in distinguishing them without external verification.

Legal Education Community.name: Analytical Application Quality
Legal Education Community.description: Assesses how effectively the summary walks students through applying the identified rules to the facts and explains the outcome.

sub_criteria.name: Element-by-Element Application
sub_criteria.description: Whether analysis explicitly addresses each rule element or factor with corresponding facts.

sub_criteria.name: Fact-to-Law Linkage Specificity
sub_criteria.description: Specificity in linking concrete facts to legal conclusions rather than making conclusory statements.

sub_criteria.name: Counterarguments/Alternatives Acknowledged
sub_criteria.description: Recognition of plausible counterarguments or alternative interpretations mentioned within the summary and their disposition.

sub_criteria.name: Use of Policy in Analysis (if present)
sub_criteria.description: Integration of policy considerations into the reasoning where the summary includes them, clearly labeled as policy.

sub_criteria.name: Explains Why Outcome Follows
sub_criteria.description: Clarity in articulating the causal chain from rule and facts to the holding to aid student understanding of legal reasoning.

Legal Education Community.name: Structural Organization for Teaching Use
Legal Education Community.description: Evaluates whether the summary is organized in a way that aligns with legal pedagogy, enabling quick reference and classroom use.

sub_criteria.name: IRAC/CRAC Segmentation
sub_criteria.description: Presence of clear sections for Issue/Conclusion, Rule, Application/Analysis, and Conclusion/Holding.

sub_criteria.name: Section Headings and Labels
sub_criteria.description: Use of explicit headings or labels (e.g., Facts, Issue, Rule, Analysis, Holding) to guide reading and teaching.

sub_criteria.name: Logical Flow and Transitions
sub_criteria.description: Coherent sequencing from facts to issues to rules to analysis to conclusion, with clear transitions.

sub_criteria.name: Use of Lists/Numbering for Elements
sub_criteria.description: Effective use of lists or numbering to present elements, factors, or steps for student memorization and review.

Legal Education Community.name: Distinction Between Holding, Dicta, and Policy
Legal Education Community.description: Assesses clarity in differentiating binding holdings from dicta and policy commentary within the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Holding vs Dicta Clearly Distinguished
sub_criteria.description: Whether statements of law essential to the outcome are distinguished from ancillary observations within the summary text itself.

sub_criteria.name: Binding Reasoning Highlighted
sub_criteria.description: Highlighting or explicit labeling of the controlling legal rationale as opposed to illustrative commentary, within the provided summary.

sub_criteria.name: Policy Considerations Labeled as Policy
sub_criteria.description: Policy discussions, if included, are clearly identified as policy rather than rule or holding to avoid student confusion.

Legal Education Community.name: Pedagogical Features and Study Aids
Legal Education Community.description: Evaluates inclusion of instructional aids that enhance learning and discussion, as presented within the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Key Takeaways/Black-Letter Highlights
sub_criteria.description: Presence of concise bullet points or boxed rules summarizing essential principles for quick review.

sub_criteria.name: Study Questions/Prompts
sub_criteria.description: Inclusion of questions that stimulate class discussion or self-assessment based on the summary alone.

sub_criteria.name: Hypotheticals/Examples
sub_criteria.description: Provision of illustrative hypotheticals or examples tied to the articulated rules within the summary text.

sub_criteria.name: Comparative Notes (if included)
sub_criteria.description: Notes comparing the case to other approaches/doctrines when such comparisons are present in the summary itself.

sub_criteria.name: Learning Objectives/Teaching Points
sub_criteria.description: Explicit statements of what students should learn from the case according to the summary author’s framing.

Legal Education Community.name: Neutrality and Balance
Legal Education Community.description: Evaluates whether the summary maintains an objective tone and fairly presents parties’ positions, supporting unbiased learning.

sub_criteria.name: Presentation of Both Sides' Arguments
sub_criteria.description: Fair articulation of the main arguments raised by each side, as described in the summary, before adopting the court’s view.

sub_criteria.name: Objective Tone
sub_criteria.description: Use of neutral language without advocacy or value-laden characterizations not supported by the described reasoning/facts in the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Avoids Loaded or Biased Language
sub_criteria.description: Refrains from pejorative descriptors or rhetorical framing that could skew student interpretation of the legal analysis.

Legal Education Community.name: Readability and Accessibility
Legal Education Community.description: Assesses clarity and readability for students at varied levels, including appropriate use and explanation of legal terminology.

sub_criteria.name: Reading Level Appropriateness
sub_criteria.description: The prose is accessible to law students without oversimplifying core legal concepts; sentence complexity is manageable for study use.

sub_criteria.name: Jargon Explained or Minimized
sub_criteria.description: Specialized terms are defined or minimized within the summary to support comprehension without external resources.

sub_criteria.name: Conciseness vs Redundancy
sub_criteria.description: Information density is appropriate: avoids repetition while providing enough detail for understanding and review.

sub_criteria.name: Sentence and Paragraph Clarity
sub_criteria.description: Sentences and paragraphs are well-structured, with clear topic sentences aiding quick scanning during class prep.

Legal Education Community.name: Internal Consistency and Coherence
Legal Education Community.description: Evaluates internal accuracy and coherence without relying on external sources: consistency of names, roles, timelines, and cross-references.

sub_criteria.name: Consistent Party Names and Roles
sub_criteria.description: Parties are identified consistently across the summary with stable roles (plaintiff, defendant, appellant, etc.).

sub_criteria.name: Timeline/Sequence Consistency
sub_criteria.description: Events and procedural steps are presented in a consistent, non-contradictory sequence within the summary narrative.

sub_criteria.name: No Contradictions Across Sections
sub_criteria.description: Facts, issues, rules, and holdings do not contradict each other within the summary’s own content.

sub_criteria.name: Cross-References Accuracy
sub_criteria.description: When the summary refers back to earlier parts (e.g., 'as stated above'), those references align correctly with the content presented.

Legal Education Community.name: Transferability to New Fact Patterns
Legal Education Community.description: Assesses whether the summary equips students to apply the articulated rules to novel hypos and exam scenarios.

sub_criteria.name: Generalizable Rule Statements
sub_criteria.description: Rules are expressed in a way that can be abstracted beyond the case-specific facts for exam use and hypos.

sub_criteria.name: Conditions/Thresholds Clarified
sub_criteria.description: Important thresholds or triggers for rule application are clearly indicated (e.g., 'substantial certainty,' 'materiality').

sub_criteria.name: Factors and Balancing Guidance
sub_criteria.description: Where balancing tests apply, the relevant factors and how to weigh them are articulated in the summary text itself.

sub_criteria.name: Outcome Sensitivity Explained
sub_criteria.description: The summary indicates how changes in facts could affect the outcome, enabling comparative analysis for students if discussed in the summary.

Legal Education Community.name: Doctrinal Context and Case Significance
Legal Education Community.description: Evaluates how well the summary situates the case within a doctrinal area and communicates its teaching value, as described within the text.

sub_criteria.name: Doctrinal Area Identified
sub_criteria.description: The relevant subject area or doctrine (e.g., Contracts—Consideration) is explicitly identified in the summary itself.

sub_criteria.name: Pedagogical Significance Stated
sub_criteria.description: The summary articulates why the case matters for learning (e.g., introduces/illustrates/refines a rule) within the summary text.

sub_criteria.name: Relationship to Other Cases (if mentioned)
sub_criteria.description: Any described comparisons or contrasts with other cases/doctrines are clearly explained without requiring outside sources.

Legal Education Community.name: Citation and Case Identification Completeness
Legal Education Community.description: Assesses the presence and clarity of case identification details and citation formatting as presented within the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Court/Jurisdiction Identified
sub_criteria.description: Whether the court and jurisdiction are indicated within the summary content.

sub_criteria.name: Decision Date/Year Identified
sub_criteria.description: Whether the decision’s date or year is specified in the summary text.

sub_criteria.name: Pin Cites/Section References
sub_criteria.description: Presence and clarity of any pinpoint citations or internal references included in the summary without verifying external accuracy.

sub_criteria.name: Citation Formatting Consistency
sub_criteria.description: Consistency of citation style within the summary (e.g., uniform presentation of case names and years).

Journalism & Media.name: Outcome Clarity
Journalism & Media.description: How clearly and quickly the summary communicates the decision and who prevailed, with emphasis on explicitness and placement.

sub_criteria.name: Winner/Loser Identification
sub_criteria.description: Whether the prevailing party is explicitly identified and roles are clear (e.g., plaintiff/defendant, appellant/appellee).
accepted_values: Clearly stated with explicit party names and roles

sub_criteria.name: Disposition Label Specificity
sub_criteria.description: Clarity and precision of the disposition label (e.g., dismissed with/without prejudice, summary judgment granted/denied, affirmed/reversed).
accepted_values: Specific with key qualifiers (e.g., with prejudice)
Specific with qualifiers and rule/statute reference

sub_criteria.name: Placement/Front-loading
sub_criteria.description: How early the outcome is presented and how easy it is to find.
accepted_values: Front-loaded (first sentence or clearly labeled box)

sub_criteria.name: Headline/Lead Summary Line
sub_criteria.description: Presence and clarity of a headline or lead line summarizing the outcome.

sub_criteria.name: Ambiguity and Hedging
sub_criteria.description: Degree to which language is direct and unambiguous about the outcome.

Journalism & Media.name: Reasoning and Holdings Clarity
Journalism & Media.description: Whether the summary concisely explains the court’s core holding and the rationale in plain terms suitable for reporting.

sub_criteria.name: Core Holding Stated
sub_criteria.description: Explicit statement of the main holding/decision point (the legal conclusion).

sub_criteria.name: Legal Standard/Test Explained
sub_criteria.description: Clarity in describing the governing legal standard or test applied (e.g., likelihood of success, strict scrutiny) in plain language.

sub_criteria.name: Key Reasons Summarized
sub_criteria.description: Concise summary of the main reasons supporting the holding without unnecessary detail.

sub_criteria.name: Limitations/Scope of Holding
sub_criteria.description: Identification of caveats, narrow tailoring, or limits (e.g., applies only to certain parties/issues).

sub_criteria.name: Counterarguments/Rejected Points
sub_criteria.description: Brief acknowledgment of significant arguments the court rejected and why (if covered in the summary).

Journalism & Media.name: Outcome Detail Granularity
Journalism & Media.description: Degree of specific, actionable detail provided about the decision beyond basic clarity, enabling precise reporting.

sub_criteria.name: Per-claim/Per-count Disposition
sub_criteria.description: Whether the outcome is broken down by each claim/count or issue.

sub_criteria.name: Relief/Remedy Specificity
sub_criteria.description: Specificity of remedies (e.g., damages amounts, injunction scope, fees, sentencing terms).

sub_criteria.name: Vote/Split or Panel Details (if applicable)
sub_criteria.description: Presence and clarity of vote count, concurrences/dissents, or panel composition when relevant.
accepted_values: Comprehensive (vote, authors, joins, summaries of positions)

sub_criteria.name: Conditions/Limitations on Relief
sub_criteria.description: Clarity about stays, conditions, partial enforcement, or temporal limits on the order.

sub_criteria.name: Monetary Awards/Calculations Precision
sub_criteria.description: Precision and breakdown of monetary components (damages, fees, costs, interest).
accepted_values: All figures precise with breakdown and calculation basis (e.g., interest)

sub_criteria.name: Scope of Relief (Parties/Geography/Class)
sub_criteria.description: Clarity on who is bound/benefited by the order and any geographic or class-wide reach.

sub_criteria.name: Enforcement Mechanisms/Compliance Provisions
sub_criteria.description: Details on enforcement tools (e.g., contempt, reporting requirements) and oversight.
accepted_values: Comprehensive mechanisms with oversight and penalties

Journalism & Media.name: Key Facts and Case Context Completeness
Journalism & Media.description: Coverage of essential who/what/when/where/how context that reporters need to situate the case, excluding outcome specifics.

sub_criteria.name: Parties and Roles Identified
sub_criteria.description: Names of key parties and their roles (e.g., plaintiff/defendant, appellant/appellee).

sub_criteria.name: Court and Jurisdiction
sub_criteria.description: Court name, level, and jurisdiction/location are stated.

sub_criteria.name: Case Caption/Number
sub_criteria.description: Presence of case caption and/or docket number for citation.
accepted_values: Present, clear, and easy to copy

sub_criteria.name: Causes of Action/Charges
sub_criteria.description: List or description of key legal claims or charges at issue.

sub_criteria.name: Procedural Posture
sub_criteria.description: Current stage of the case at decision time (e.g., motion to dismiss, summary judgment, appeal).

sub_criteria.name: Key Dates (Timeline)
sub_criteria.description: Inclusion of pivotal timeline dates (e.g., filing, major prior rulings, current decision).
accepted_values: Key dates complete and easy to scan

sub_criteria.name: Brief Background Facts
sub_criteria.description: Short, factual background explaining the dispute in 1-3 concise sentences.

sub_criteria.name: Geographic Specificity
sub_criteria.description: Clear identification of relevant locations (e.g., city/state/region) tied to the parties or events.

sub_criteria.name: Representatives/Counsel (if provided)
sub_criteria.description: Names of attorneys or representatives for key parties, if included by the summary format.

sub_criteria.name: Prior Procedural History (Brief)
sub_criteria.description: Concise summary of major prior rulings or steps leading to the present decision.

sub_criteria.name: Case Type and Subject Matter Tags
sub_criteria.description: Explicit identification of case type (civil/criminal/admin) and subject matter category (e.g., employment, antitrust).

Journalism & Media.name: Allegations vs. Findings Separation
Journalism & Media.description: Clarity in distinguishing unproven allegations and party claims from the court’s factual findings and holdings to avoid misleading reporting.

sub_criteria.name: Labeling of Allegations vs. Findings
sub_criteria.description: Use of explicit labels or headings to separate allegations from findings/holdings.

sub_criteria.name: Attribution Verbs and Source Clarity
sub_criteria.description: Consistent use of attribution (e.g., 'plaintiffs allege', 'the court found') to indicate the source of statements.

sub_criteria.name: Structural Separation
sub_criteria.description: Physical separation of allegations and findings via headings, bullets, or sections.

sub_criteria.name: Quotation vs. Paraphrase Distinction
sub_criteria.description: Clear marking of direct quotes versus paraphrases of the decision or filings.

sub_criteria.name: Qualifiers for Unproven Claims
sub_criteria.description: Appropriate qualifiers to avoid presenting allegations as facts.

Journalism & Media.name: Attribution and Source Traceability
Journalism & Media.description: Whether the summary enables journalists to trace and cite the source decision/order through explicit citations and identifiers.

sub_criteria.name: Document Type Labeled
sub_criteria.description: Identification of whether it is an order, opinion, judgment, indictment, etc.

sub_criteria.name: Decision Date/Time Cited
sub_criteria.description: Presence and clarity of decision date (and time if relevant).

sub_criteria.name: Judge/Author Identified
sub_criteria.description: Judge’s name or authoring justice identified.

sub_criteria.name: Docket/Case Number Provided
sub_criteria.description: Inclusion of the docket or case number.
accepted_values: Present, clear, and cross-referenced with caption

sub_criteria.name: Citation/Link String Included
sub_criteria.description: Presence of a citation or link text that points to the source document (not externally verified).

sub_criteria.name: Source Host/Repository Identified
sub_criteria.description: Name of the source platform (e.g., court website, PACER, state portal) and, if applicable, access notes.
accepted_values: Clearly named with access notes (e.g., paywall/login)

sub_criteria.name: Pinpoint/Section References
sub_criteria.description: Pin cites or section/page references for key propositions or quotes.
accepted_values: Systematic pin cites for all key points

Journalism & Media.name: Legal Citations Utility
Journalism & Media.description: Inclusion and clarity of relevant statutes, rules, and precedent citations helpful for further reporting and context within the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Statutes/Rules Cited
sub_criteria.description: Relevant statutes and rules are cited clearly with identifiers.

sub_criteria.name: Precedent Case Citations
sub_criteria.description: Inclusion of key case citations that frame the holding.

sub_criteria.name: Pin Cites/Sections for Authorities
sub_criteria.description: Pinpoint citations (sections/pages) for statutes and cases where relevant.
accepted_values: Systematic pin cites for key authorities

sub_criteria.name: Jurisdiction and Court Identification for Citations
sub_criteria.description: Each citation includes court and year where applicable.

sub_criteria.name: Relevance Notes/Parentheticals
sub_criteria.description: Brief parentheticals indicating why each authority matters.

Journalism & Media.name: Readability and Jargon Translation
Journalism & Media.description: Use of plain language and explanations for legal terms so non-legal newsroom staff can understand and rephrase accurately.

sub_criteria.name: Plain Language Level
sub_criteria.description: Overall simplicity and clarity of prose relative to the audience.

sub_criteria.name: Jargon Definition/Translation
sub_criteria.description: Whether legal terms are defined or translated into plain English when first used.

sub_criteria.name: Acronyms and Abbreviations
sub_criteria.description: First-use expansion and consistent use of acronyms (e.g., TRO, SJ).
accepted_values: Expanded on first use and reinforced in text

sub_criteria.name: Sentence and Paragraph Structure
sub_criteria.description: Use of short sentences, logical paragraphs, and transitions to aid comprehension.

sub_criteria.name: Numbers/Dates Presentation Clarity
sub_criteria.description: Clarity and consistency in presenting numbers, dates, and percentages (e.g., digit grouping, date formats).

Journalism & Media.name: Concision and Skimmability
Journalism & Media.description: Efficiency of presentation for quick newsroom use: appropriate length, scannable sections, bullets, and headings for at-a-glance extraction.

sub_criteria.name: Length vs. Complexity
sub_criteria.description: Appropriateness of length relative to case complexity and audience needs.
accepted_values: Highly concise without loss of substance

sub_criteria.name: Headings and Subheadings
sub_criteria.description: Use of informative headings to chunk information.

sub_criteria.name: Lists and Tables for Dense Data
sub_criteria.description: Use of bullets/tables for claims, parties, amounts, and timelines.

sub_criteria.name: Information Hierarchy/Lead
sub_criteria.description: Front-loading of key takeaways and progressive disclosure of detail.

sub_criteria.name: Redundancy Minimization
sub_criteria.description: Avoidance of repetitive statements and unnecessary detail.

Journalism & Media.name: Next Steps and Timeline
Journalism & Media.description: Clarity about what happens next procedurally and when, enabling planning for follow-up coverage.

sub_criteria.name: Appealability/Deadlines
sub_criteria.description: Whether appeal options and windows are stated if applicable.

sub_criteria.name: Scheduled Hearings/Key Dates
sub_criteria.description: Listing of upcoming hearings or milestone dates.

sub_criteria.name: Compliance/Remedy Timeline
sub_criteria.description: Timing for compliance, enforcement, or remedy implementation.

sub_criteria.name: Pending Motions/Further Filings
sub_criteria.description: Identification of pending motions or expected filings.

sub_criteria.name: Stay/Enforcement Status
sub_criteria.description: Disclosure of any stays or immediate enforceability of the order.

sub_criteria.name: Responsible Parties/Agencies for Next Actions
sub_criteria.description: Identification of who must act next (e.g., defendant, agency, court clerk).

sub_criteria.name: Contingency/Trigger Conditions
sub_criteria.description: Clarity on conditions that alter next steps (e.g., if bond posted, if appeal filed).

Journalism & Media.name: Quotable Elements
Journalism & Media.description: Availability of concise, attributable lines (verbatim or well-marked paraphrases) suitable as pull quotes or broadcast soundbites.

sub_criteria.name: Verbatim Judicial Quotes
sub_criteria.description: Presence of short, impactful quotes from the opinion/order.

sub_criteria.name: Paraphrase Accuracy and Labeling
sub_criteria.description: Paraphrases of holdings are accurate and explicitly marked as such.

sub_criteria.name: Attribution Specificity
sub_criteria.description: Clarity about who said/wrote the quoted or paraphrased content (judge name, panel, section).

sub_criteria.name: Brevity/Soundbite Quality
sub_criteria.description: Quotes or paraphrases are concise and media-friendly.

Journalism & Media.name: Newsworthiness Signals and Impact Framing
Journalism & Media.description: Identification of stakes, affected groups, and why the decision matters for audiences, without speculation beyond the summary’s content.

sub_criteria.name: Stakes/Impact Explained
sub_criteria.description: Clarity on what is at stake (e.g., money, policy, rights).

sub_criteria.name: Affected Groups/Entities Identified
sub_criteria.description: Identification of who is affected (parties, class members, industries, communities).

sub_criteria.name: Geographic/Policy Scope
sub_criteria.description: Clarifies whether effects are local, statewide, nationwide, or policy-limited.

sub_criteria.name: Novelty/Precedent Significance (if applicable)
sub_criteria.description: Indicates if the decision is first-of-its-kind, creates a split, or relies on key precedent, as stated within the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Avoidance of Speculation
sub_criteria.description: Refrains from forecasting beyond the record; distinguishes facts from possible implications.

Journalism & Media.name: Internal Consistency and Coherence
Journalism & Media.description: The summary is self-consistent (names, dates, numbers) and logically organized without contradictions.

sub_criteria.name: Names/Roles Consistency
sub_criteria.description: Consistency in spelling and roles of parties, judges, counsel.

sub_criteria.name: Dates/Numbers Consistency
sub_criteria.description: Consistency of dates, times, docket numbers, and amounts across sections.

sub_criteria.name: Cross-Reference Alignment
sub_criteria.description: Headings, labels, and references (e.g., 'see above') are accurate.

sub_criteria.name: Logical Flow/Organization
sub_criteria.description: Information follows a coherent, predictable order.

Journalism & Media.name: Data Extractability and Structure
Journalism & Media.description: Presence of structured, copy-friendly fields (e.g., labeled sections, bullet lists, tables, consistent labels) and easily copied numbers/dates.

sub_criteria.name: Standard Section Labels
sub_criteria.description: Use of standard labels (e.g., Outcome, Parties, Court, Dates, Claims).

sub_criteria.name: Field Standardization for Key Data
sub_criteria.description: Consistent formatting for caption, docket, judge, dates, amounts.

sub_criteria.name: Copy/Paste Friendliness
sub_criteria.description: Data are easy to copy without artifacts (line breaks in numbers, odd spacing).

sub_criteria.name: Use of Lists/Tables for Multi-Item Data
sub_criteria.description: Claims, parties, counts, and outcomes are presented in structured lists/tables.

sub_criteria.name: Consistent Labeling/Icons/Key
sub_criteria.description: Labels, icons, or keys (if used) are consistent and explained.

Journalism & Media.name: Neutral Tone and Non-sensationalism
Journalism & Media.description: Objective, balanced tone without loaded or emotive language; fair characterization of parties and issues.

sub_criteria.name: Language Neutrality
sub_criteria.description: Avoids loaded adjectives/adverbs and emotive phrasing.

sub_criteria.name: Balance in Presentation
sub_criteria.description: Fair presentation of parties’ positions and the court’s reasoning.

sub_criteria.name: Attribution for Evaluative Statements
sub_criteria.description: Evaluative or characterizing statements are attributed to the court or filings.

sub_criteria.name: Avoidance of Hyperbole/Speculation
sub_criteria.description: Refrains from exaggeration and unsupported conclusions.

Journalism & Media.name: Updates/Corrections and Versioning Transparency
Journalism & Media.description: Signals that help journalists assess whether the summary reflects the latest status and whether changes have been made.

sub_criteria.name: Update/Correction Note Presence
sub_criteria.description: Explicit note if the summary has been updated or corrected.

sub_criteria.name: Version Date/Time Stamp
sub_criteria.description: Visible date/time stamp for the summary’s current version.

sub_criteria.name: Change Summary
sub_criteria.description: Brief description of what changed in the updated summary (if applicable).

sub_criteria.name: Related/Superseded Orders Noted
sub_criteria.description: Identification of related or superseding decisions that affect current understanding, as stated in the summary.

Journalism & Media.name: Audience Fit and Role-Specific Utility
Journalism & Media.description: Alignment of the summary’s content, depth, and format with the needs of identified target user types (e.g., reporter, editor, producer, data desk, general audience).

sub_criteria.name: Target Personas Addressed
sub_criteria.description: Whether the summary explicitly or implicitly addresses one or more target user types and their needs.

sub_criteria.name: Layered Summary Formats
sub_criteria.description: Availability of tiered lengths (e.g., 1-sentence, brief, full) for different users.

sub_criteria.name: Actionability for Newsroom Tasks
sub_criteria.description: Presence of ready-to-use elements (e.g., suggested slug/headline, key bullet points, pull-quotes).

sub_criteria.name: Background Knowledge Calibration
sub_criteria.description: Assumed expertise level is appropriate for intended users and is signposted if advanced.

sub_criteria.name: Cross-Desk Reusability
sub_criteria.description: Utility across roles (print/online, broadcast, social, data).

Journalism & Media.name: Substantive Accuracy and Fidelity to Source
Journalism & Media.description: Faithfulness of the summary to the underlying decision/order and filings, avoiding errors or unsupported claims.

sub_criteria.name: Factual Accuracy vs. Record
sub_criteria.description: Correctness of parties, facts, dates, and procedural posture vis-à-vis the source.

sub_criteria.name: Legal Accuracy of Holdings/Standards
sub_criteria.description: Correct articulation of holdings, standards, and outcomes.

sub_criteria.name: Quote Fidelity
sub_criteria.description: Correctness of quoted language (verbatim, punctuation) and accurate attribution.

sub_criteria.name: Numerical/Data Accuracy
sub_criteria.description: Correctness of amounts, calculations, and unit/currency presentation.

sub_criteria.name: Unsupported Claims/Hallucinations
sub_criteria.description: Presence of statements not supported by the decision/order or filings.

sub_criteria.name: Material Omissions Risk
sub_criteria.description: Whether crucial aspects that affect understanding are omitted.

Journalism & Media.name: Ethical and Privacy Safeguards
Journalism & Media.description: Protection of sensitive information and adherence to ethical norms (especially in criminal and sensitive civil matters).

sub_criteria.name: Sealed/Restricted Information Handling
sub_criteria.description: Avoids disclosing sealed or restricted details; flags restrictions where relevant.

sub_criteria.name: Sensitive Personal Information Minimization
sub_criteria.description: Treatment of addresses, medical data, contact info, and identifiers (e.g., SSN).

sub_criteria.name: Criminal Case Presumptions
sub_criteria.description: Use of 'alleged' and posture-aware language to preserve presumption of innocence.

sub_criteria.name: Victim/Minor Protections
sub_criteria.description: Approach to naming or describing victims/minors in line with policy.

sub_criteria.name: Defamation Risk Controls
sub_criteria.description: Avoids defamatory characterizations; uses attribution and precise language.

Journalism & Media.name: Accessibility and Device Compatibility
Journalism & Media.description: Ease of use across devices and for assistive technologies to maximize utility for diverse users.

sub_criteria.name: Mobile Readability
sub_criteria.description: Legibility and layout on small screens (paragraph length, font/spacing implications).

sub_criteria.name: Heading/Semantic Structure
sub_criteria.description: Use of semantic headings/lists that aid screen readers.

sub_criteria.name: Link Text Descriptiveness
sub_criteria.description: Descriptive link text instead of generic 'click here'.

sub_criteria.name: Alt Text for Graphics/Tables (if any)
sub_criteria.description: Provision of alt text or captions for non-text elements.

Journalism & Media.name: Multiplatform Readiness and Packaging
Journalism & Media.description: Preparedness of the summary for use across platforms (web, print, social, broadcast).

sub_criteria.name: Headline/Slug Variants
sub_criteria.description: Provision of alternative headlines/slugs for different platforms.

sub_criteria.name: Social/Broadcast Blurbs
sub_criteria.description: Concise blurbs suitable for social posts and broadcast intros.

sub_criteria.name: SEO/Metadata Cues
sub_criteria.description: Keywords/tags and meta description guidance to aid discovery.

sub_criteria.name: Visual Aids (Timelines/Tables) Readiness
sub_criteria.description: Presence or readiness of simple visuals (timeline/table) to support multiplatform use.

Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.name: Audience and Use-Case Alignment
Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.description: Evaluates whether the summary is tailored to policy and advocacy stakeholders and their real tasks, enabling immediate, practical use without additional interpretation.

sub_criteria.name: Primary Audience Identified
sub_criteria.description: Clarity about who the summary is for and the expected context and expertise of readers.

sub_criteria.name: Use Cases and Tasks Supported
sub_criteria.description: Specific stakeholder tasks the summary enables, and the practical supports provided.

sub_criteria.name: Relevance Cues (Why It Matters)
sub_criteria.description: Signals connecting the decision to policy priorities, legislative cycles, or advocacy workflows.

sub_criteria.name: Alternative Formats/Length Options
sub_criteria.description: Availability and navigability of TL;DR, one-pager, and deeper-dive formats for varied needs.

sub_criteria.name: Accessibility Accommodations
sub_criteria.description: Readability structure, language access, and assistive technology compatibility.

Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.name: Outcome and Disposition Clarity
Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.description: Assesses whether the summary clearly states who prevailed, the court’s disposition, and any orders or remedies, so advocates can act with confidence.

sub_criteria.name: Winner Identified
sub_criteria.description: Explicit identification of the prevailing party or parties.

sub_criteria.name: Disposition Specified
sub_criteria.description: Explicit statement of the court’s action (e.g., affirmed, reversed, vacated, dismissed, remanded).

sub_criteria.name: Remedy/Orders Detailed
sub_criteria.description: Practical orders or remedies described (e.g., injunction granted, damages awarded, remand instructions).

sub_criteria.name: Scope of Relief
sub_criteria.description: Level of detail on beneficiaries and limits of relief.

sub_criteria.name: Multiple Claims/Counts Outcomes
sub_criteria.description: Clarity where different claims or parties have different outcomes.

sub_criteria.name: Stay/Enforcement Status
sub_criteria.description: Whether orders are stayed, immediately effective, or contingent.

sub_criteria.name: Fees/Costs Awards
sub_criteria.description: Attorneys’ fees, costs, or sanctions awarded or reserved.

sub_criteria.name: Retroactivity/Prospective Application
sub_criteria.description: Explicitness on whether the decision applies retroactively or prospectively only.

sub_criteria.name: Operative Holding vs. Dicta
sub_criteria.description: Clarity distinguishing the binding holding from dicta.

Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.name: Factual Background and Case Context
Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.description: Evaluates presentation of material facts and context needed to understand the holding and its policy implications.

sub_criteria.name: Parties and Roles
sub_criteria.description: Identification of parties, capacities, and relevant relationships.

sub_criteria.name: Material Facts Essential to Holding
sub_criteria.description: Coverage and prioritization of facts the court relied on to reach its decision.

sub_criteria.name: Timeline of Key Events
sub_criteria.description: Chronological anchors that clarify sequence and causation.

sub_criteria.name: Facts vs. Allegations
sub_criteria.description: Distinguishing established facts from disputed allegations or arguments.

sub_criteria.name: Procedural vs. Merits Facts
sub_criteria.description: Separation of procedural history from merits facts for clarity.

sub_criteria.name: Venue/Transfer History
sub_criteria.description: Noting venue, transfers, or consolidation that affect context.

sub_criteria.name: Factual Source Indicators
sub_criteria.description: Identification of sources (record cites, exhibits) for critical facts, as reflected in the summary.
accepted_values: 2 - Specific source cues (e.g., record cite, exhibit)

Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.name: Legal Issues and Standards Articulated
Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.description: Evaluates identification of the central legal questions and the standards/tests applied, with reasoning that translates into advocacy insights.

sub_criteria.name: Issues Identified
sub_criteria.description: Number and clarity of the legal questions presented.

sub_criteria.name: Holding Statement Clarity
sub_criteria.description: A concise statement of the holding capturing the legal rule applied.

sub_criteria.name: Legal Standards/Tests Named
sub_criteria.description: Identification of controlling standards, elements, or tests.
accepted_values: 3 - Named with elements and brief explanation/citation

sub_criteria.name: Application of Standards to Facts
sub_criteria.description: Clarity on how the court applied the standard to the facts to reach the holding.

sub_criteria.name: Sources of Law Cited
sub_criteria.description: Statutes, constitutional provisions, regulations, or rules identified as relevant.
accepted_values: 1 - At least one relevant source named

sub_criteria.name: Remedial Standards Identified
sub_criteria.description: Standards governing remedies (e.g., injunction factors) where relevant.

Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.name: Jurisdiction and Precedential Scope
Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.description: Checks whether the summary states the court level, jurisdiction, and the scope of precedential effect for transferability and strategy.

sub_criteria.name: Court Level and Name
sub_criteria.description: Issuing court and its level within the judicial hierarchy.

sub_criteria.name: Geographic and Subject-Matter Jurisdiction
sub_criteria.description: Scope of authority over geography and subject area relevant to the case.

sub_criteria.name: Precedential Weight and Publication Status
sub_criteria.description: Binding/persuasive effect and whether the opinion is published/non-precedential.

sub_criteria.name: Scope of Applicability Explanation
sub_criteria.description: How and where the decision is likely to apply (e.g., within circuit/state; persuasive elsewhere) and any limits.
accepted_values: 2 - Detailed explanation with examples or limits

sub_criteria.name: Panel Composition and Opinion Type
sub_criteria.description: Authoring judge, panel composition, per curiam, plurality.

sub_criteria.name: En Banc/Certification Status
