sub_criteria.description: Whether the case is en banc or certified questions are involved.

Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.name: Procedural Posture and Next Steps
Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.description: Assesses clarity about the procedural stage and what comes next, enabling planning for advocacy and oversight.

sub_criteria.name: Current Posture Clarity
sub_criteria.description: Procedural stage at decision time, including motion/proceeding type.

sub_criteria.name: Prior Procedural History
sub_criteria.description: Key prior orders or decisions relevant to current posture.

sub_criteria.name: Standard of Review
sub_criteria.description: Standard(s) of review applicable to the posture (e.g., de novo, abuse of discretion).

sub_criteria.name: Next Steps Identified
sub_criteria.description: Future procedural actions (e.g., possible appeal, remand proceedings) and expectations.

sub_criteria.name: Deadlines/Timing Signals
sub_criteria.description: Dates or timing cues relevant to planning action or oversight.

sub_criteria.name: Mandate/Remand Instructions Clarity
sub_criteria.description: Specific tasks or boundaries provided for remand or mandate.

sub_criteria.name: Parties’ Roles on Appeal
sub_criteria.description: Identification of appellants/appellees or petitioners/respondents.

sub_criteria.name: Relief Sought at This Stage
sub_criteria.description: What relief the moving party sought in the resolved stage.

Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.name: Policy Implications and Regulatory Levers
Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.description: Evaluates how well the summary translates the decision into policy-relevant implications and identifies concrete levers for action.

sub_criteria.name: Policy Areas Named
sub_criteria.description: Policy domains affected (e.g., health, environment, labor, education).

sub_criteria.name: Levers Identified
sub_criteria.description: Identification of concrete mechanisms to act on the decision.

sub_criteria.name: Specificity of Impacts
sub_criteria.description: Clarity about how the decision changes obligations, risks, or operations.

sub_criteria.name: Government Levels Implicated
sub_criteria.description: Local, state, federal, or multi-level implications identified.

sub_criteria.name: Feasibility and Constraints
sub_criteria.description: Legal, political, fiscal, or operational constraints/enablers acknowledged.
accepted_values: 3 - Practical feasibility assessment with blockers and mitigations

sub_criteria.name: Urgency/Priority Signals
sub_criteria.description: Indications of time sensitivity or priority ranking for action.
accepted_values: 2 - Specific priority or time-sensitive windows identified

Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.name: Stakeholder and Population Impact Identification
Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.description: Assesses whether the summary identifies affected populations, sectors, and geographies and describes the nature of impact for equity-aware policy design.

sub_criteria.name: Populations Affected
sub_criteria.description: Specific communities or demographics impacted.

sub_criteria.name: Sectors/Industries Affected
sub_criteria.description: Relevant sectors or industries involved or affected.

sub_criteria.name: Geographic Scope of Impact
sub_criteria.description: Local, state, regional, or nationwide impact clarity.

sub_criteria.name: Nature and Directionality of Impact
sub_criteria.description: Benefits, burdens, risks, or mixed impacts with examples.

sub_criteria.name: Magnitude/Scale of Impact
sub_criteria.description: Relative scale or estimated magnitude as stated in the summary.
accepted_values: 2 - Quantified or estimated magnitude where feasible

sub_criteria.name: Equity and Disparity Considerations
sub_criteria.description: Attention to disparate impacts on protected or vulnerable groups.

sub_criteria.name: Data Sources/Evidence for Impact
sub_criteria.description: Whether impact claims are tied to data or credible sources.
accepted_values: 2 - Specific datasets, reports, or citations noted

sub_criteria.name: Beneficiary/Burden Mapping by Group
sub_criteria.description: Clarity on which groups benefit versus bear burdens.

Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.name: Risks, Limitations, and Uncertainties
Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.description: Evaluates inclusion of caveats that shape strategy, such as narrow holdings, preserved issues, or conflicting interpretations, enabling realistic advocacy planning.

sub_criteria.name: Scope/Narrowness of Holding
sub_criteria.description: How broad or narrow the holding is and any limiting language.
accepted_values: 3 - Detailed boundaries with quoted/parsed limiting language

sub_criteria.name: Open Questions/Preserved Issues
sub_criteria.description: Issues left unresolved or preserved for future litigation/policy choices.
accepted_values: 3 - Open issues mapped to future litigation/policy choices

sub_criteria.name: Conflicts/Splits
sub_criteria.description: Presence of intra- or inter-jurisdictional conflicts or splits identified in the summary.
accepted_values: 3 - Implications for en banc or certiorari discussed

sub_criteria.name: Separate Opinions
sub_criteria.description: Dissents, concurrences, and their practical implications.

sub_criteria.name: Likelihood/Status of Further Review
sub_criteria.description: Signals of appeal, en banc rehearing, or certiorari as noted in the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Ambiguities/Record Limitations
sub_criteria.description: Ambiguous facts or record gaps affecting interpretation as flagged by the summary.
accepted_values: 2 - Specific ambiguities and their consequences identified

sub_criteria.name: Dicta vs. Holding Boundaries
sub_criteria.description: Clarity on which reasoning is binding versus suggestive.

sub_criteria.name: Remand Implementation Risks
sub_criteria.description: Risks that could arise during remand or further proceedings.

Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.name: Actionable Advocacy Opportunities
Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.description: Assesses identification of concrete, targeted advocacy actions derived directly from the decision’s holdings and reasoning.

sub_criteria.name: Action Types Enumerated
sub_criteria.description: Range of actions (legislation, regulation, comments, coalition, public education, oversight).

sub_criteria.name: Specificity and Link to Decision
sub_criteria.description: How directly actions tie to holdings, reasoning, or orders (with references).
accepted_values: 3 - Direct linkage with citations or quoted language

sub_criteria.name: Audience Targeting
sub_criteria.description: Actions tailored to specific audiences (legislators, agencies, courts, public).

sub_criteria.name: Prioritization and Sequencing
sub_criteria.description: Quality of prioritization, dependencies, and timing.

sub_criteria.name: Resourcing/Partnerships
sub_criteria.description: Identification of the resources and partners needed to execute actions.

sub_criteria.name: Metrics/Success Indicators
sub_criteria.description: Measurable indicators to track advocacy progress as proposed in the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Risk/Benefit Tradeoffs of Actions
sub_criteria.description: Analysis of risks and benefits of proposed actions.

sub_criteria.name: Sample Artifacts/Tools Provided
sub_criteria.description: Provision of templates, sample letters, checklists, or scripts.

Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.name: Implementation and Compliance Considerations
Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.description: Evaluates whether the summary notes practical implementation factors that inform policy design, sequencing, and oversight.

sub_criteria.name: Responsible Agencies/Actors
sub_criteria.description: Implementing bodies and their roles identified.

sub_criteria.name: Effective Dates/Transition Periods
sub_criteria.description: Timing for when obligations or opportunities take effect.

sub_criteria.name: Compliance Steps/Checklist
sub_criteria.description: Concrete steps required for compliance or implementation.

sub_criteria.name: Oversight/Monitoring/Reporting
sub_criteria.description: Requirements or practices for oversight, reporting, or audits.

sub_criteria.name: Resource/Cost Impact
sub_criteria.description: Budgetary or operational burdens noted in the summary (qualitative or quantitative).

sub_criteria.name: Interdependencies/Coordination Needs
sub_criteria.description: Dependencies across agencies/systems and coordination needs.

sub_criteria.name: IT/Data System Impacts
sub_criteria.description: System, data, or reporting changes implicated.

sub_criteria.name: Training and Capacity Needs
sub_criteria.description: Workforce training, guidance, or capacity-building needs.

sub_criteria.name: Legal/Contracting Changes Required
sub_criteria.description: Need to revise contracts, MOUs, or legal instruments.

Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.name: Plain-Language Accessibility and Definitions
Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.description: Assesses readability for non-lawyer policy audiences, including explanation of legal terms, acronyms, and complex concepts.

sub_criteria.name: Readability Level
sub_criteria.description: Overall readability features and grade-level accessibility.

sub_criteria.name: Jargon and Acronym Handling
sub_criteria.description: Definition or avoidance of technical terms and acronyms.
accepted_values: 2 - Most terms defined on first use

sub_criteria.name: Sentence and Paragraph Clarity
sub_criteria.description: Clarity of sentence construction and paragraph organization.

sub_criteria.name: Examples/Analogies/Definitions
sub_criteria.description: Use of examples or brief definitions to clarify complex concepts.

sub_criteria.name: Tone and Bias Control for Accessibility
sub_criteria.description: Neutral, approachable tone without alienating jargon.

sub_criteria.name: Visual Aids for Explanation
sub_criteria.description: Use of boxes, diagrams, tables to clarify complex ideas.

sub_criteria.name: Glossary/Definitions Section
sub_criteria.description: Presence of a mini-glossary or definitions for recurring terms.

Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.name: Evidence, Citations, and Quotable Language
Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.description: Evaluates inclusion of precise citations and concise, attributable language suitable for policy communications and oversight materials.

sub_criteria.name: Case Citation Precision
sub_criteria.description: Completeness of case citation (party names, reporter, court, year) and, if provided, docket or link.
accepted_values: 3 - Full citation plus docket or link

sub_criteria.name: Statutory/Regulatory Citations
sub_criteria.description: Inclusion and precision of statute/regulation citations relevant to the holding.

sub_criteria.name: Pinpoint/Record Citations
sub_criteria.description: Use of pin cites or record cites for key propositions.

sub_criteria.name: Quotable Lines Quality
sub_criteria.description: Presence of succinct quotations or paraphrases suitable for messaging/talking points.

sub_criteria.name: Attribution Clarity and Context
sub_criteria.description: Clear attribution and context for quotes and key propositions.

sub_criteria.name: Citation Style Consistency
sub_criteria.description: Consistency of citation format throughout the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Link Integrity and Persistence
sub_criteria.description: Working links with stable identifiers (e.g., DOI, permalinks).

Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.name: Timeliness and Update Signals
Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.description: Assesses inclusion of decision date, effective dates, and update mechanisms that guide advocacy timing without duplicating outcome details.

sub_criteria.name: Decision Date
sub_criteria.description: Inclusion and visibility of the decision date.

sub_criteria.name: Effective Dates and Compliance Timelines
sub_criteria.description: Dates when obligations or rights change, including staged timelines if applicable.
accepted_values: 2 - Multiple dates or staged timelines explained

sub_criteria.name: Appeal/Rehearing Status Signals
sub_criteria.description: Indicators of ongoing or anticipated appeal or rehearing status (excluding stay/enforcement, covered elsewhere).
accepted_values: 3 - Details with links or docket references

sub_criteria.name: Last Updated/Versioning
sub_criteria.description: Update stamp and change notes to signal currency.

sub_criteria.name: Update Subscription/Monitoring
sub_criteria.description: Mechanisms to receive updates (e.g., RSS, alerts) or monitor dockets as provided in the summary.
accepted_values: 2 - Link to alerts/RSS or docket subscription

sub_criteria.name: Update Cadence/Responsiveness
sub_criteria.description: How promptly the summary is updated after key docket events.
accepted_values: 2 - Prompt updates with stated cadence or SLA

sub_criteria.name: Sunset/Expiration/Review Dates
sub_criteria.description: Noting when the content or implications should be revisited (e.g., sunset clauses, scheduled reviews).
accepted_values: 2 - Specific dates or triggers for review

Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.name: Structure and Scannability
Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.description: Evaluates organization for rapid policy review, including headings, bullets, executive summary, and logical flow.

sub_criteria.name: Headings and Hierarchy
sub_criteria.description: Use of descriptive headings and subheadings.

sub_criteria.name: Executive Summary/TL;DR
sub_criteria.description: Presence and quality of a short summary for quick intake.
accepted_values: 3 - TL;DR with bullets or key takeaways

sub_criteria.name: Bullets/Lists and White Space
sub_criteria.description: Use of bullets/lists and spacing to aid scanning.

sub_criteria.name: Logical Flow and Section Ordering
sub_criteria.description: Coherent structure from facts to issues to outcomes to implications.

sub_criteria.name: Navigation Aids
sub_criteria.description: Table of contents, anchors, or internal links for quick navigation.

sub_criteria.name: Length Appropriateness
sub_criteria.description: Fit to audience needs without unnecessary detail.
accepted_values: 0 - Significantly too short or too long

sub_criteria.name: Key Takeaways/Callouts
sub_criteria.description: Highlighted boxes or callouts for critical points.

sub_criteria.name: Visual Summaries
sub_criteria.description: Tables, timelines, or flowcharts to summarize complex information.

Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.name: Neutrality and Fairness of Presentation
Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.description: Assesses whether the summary objectively presents the court’s reasoning and parties’ arguments without undue advocacy bias, preserving credibility.

sub_criteria.name: Balanced Representation of Positions
sub_criteria.description: Fair framing of both parties’ arguments and the court’s treatment.

sub_criteria.name: Separation of Facts, Holdings, and Commentary
sub_criteria.description: Clear delineation between factual summary, holding, and author commentary.

sub_criteria.name: Treatment of Counterarguments/Dissent
sub_criteria.description: Recognition and fair treatment of dissenting views or counterarguments.

sub_criteria.name: Language Neutrality
sub_criteria.description: Avoidance of loaded or pejorative terms.

sub_criteria.name: Disclosure of Perspective/Methodology
sub_criteria.description: Transparency about the summary’s purpose, scope, limits, or methodology.
accepted_values: 2 - Clear note on purpose, scope, or perspective

sub_criteria.name: Conflict of Interest/Affiliation Disclosure
sub_criteria.description: Disclosure of organizational interests relevant to the case.

sub_criteria.name: Hedging/Confidence Language Use
sub_criteria.description: Appropriate qualifiers indicating certainty/uncertainty of conclusions.

Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.name: Comparative Authority and Trends
Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.description: Evaluates whether the summary situates the case within broader legal trends or analogous authorities to guide transferability and strategic planning.

sub_criteria.name: Related/Distinguishing Precedents
sub_criteria.description: Identification of cases that align with or diverge from this decision.
accepted_values: 3 - Analysis of how the case fits or departs

sub_criteria.name: Trends/Trajectory
sub_criteria.description: Placement within doctrinal or policy trends and direction of travel.

sub_criteria.name: Cross-Jurisdiction Relevance
sub_criteria.description: Utility in other jurisdictions or forums as explained by the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Guidance for Analogous Scenarios
sub_criteria.description: Examples or heuristics for applying the decision to similar fact patterns.

sub_criteria.name: Secondary Sources/Agency Guidance
sub_criteria.description: Inclusion of treatises, agency guidance, or respected analyses that contextualize the case.

Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.name: Internal Consistency and Quality Control
Policy & Advocacy Stakeholders.description: Assesses internal coherence and basic quality checks so policy stakeholders can rely on the summary without confusion or contradiction.

sub_criteria.name: Terminology and Party Consistency
sub_criteria.description: Consistent use of names, acronyms, and defined terms throughout.

sub_criteria.name: Cross-Section Consistency
sub_criteria.description: No contradictions between sections (e.g., outcome vs. implications; dates vs. timelines).

sub_criteria.name: Dates and Numbers Consistency
sub_criteria.description: Internal consistency of dates, counts, amounts, and timelines presented.

sub_criteria.name: Citation-Claim Alignment
sub_criteria.description: Key assertions are supported by nearby citations or quotations as presented in the summary (without external verification).
accepted_values: 2 - Most key assertions supported with cites/quotes

sub_criteria.name: Link Integrity
sub_criteria.description: All provided links function and point to intended resources.

sub_criteria.name: Formatting/Typographical Quality
sub_criteria.description: Professional formatting and minimal typos or errors.

Public Self-Help Users.name: Plain Language and Readability
Public Self-Help Users.description: Evaluates how clearly the summary explains the case using everyday language that non-lawyers can understand without prior legal knowledge.

sub_criteria.name: Jargon and Acronym Explanation
sub_criteria.description: Explains or replaces legal jargon and expands acronyms on first use.
accepted_values: 5 - All jargon and acronyms explained or avoided

sub_criteria.name: Sentence Simplicity
sub_criteria.description: Uses short, direct sentences and active voice to reduce cognitive load.
accepted_values: 1 - Predominantly complex and hard to parse

sub_criteria.name: Key Term Definitions
sub_criteria.description: Defines essential legal terms the user must understand to follow the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Reading Level Appropriateness
sub_criteria.description: Keeps reading level suitable for non-lawyers (roughly middle-school to early high-school) without sacrificing accuracy.

Public Self-Help Users.name: Parties and Roles Identification
Public Self-Help Users.description: Assesses whether the summary clearly identifies who the parties are and what roles they played in the case.

sub_criteria.name: Parties Named or Clearly Labeled
sub_criteria.description: States the names or clear labels (e.g., landlord/tenant, employee/employer).

sub_criteria.name: Roles Clarified
sub_criteria.description: Explains each party’s role (e.g., plaintiff, defendant, appellant).

sub_criteria.name: Role Changes Across Stages
sub_criteria.description: Clarifies how party roles shift across procedural stages (e.g., plaintiff/appellee vs. defendant/appellant).

sub_criteria.name: Relationships and Context
sub_criteria.description: Describes the relationship between the parties and the context of the dispute (e.g., employment contract, tenancy, consumer).

sub_criteria.name: Non-Party Participants Noted
sub_criteria.description: Identifies amici, intervenors, agencies, or class representatives when material to understanding the case.

sub_criteria.name: Multiple Parties Disambiguated
sub_criteria.description: Uses unambiguous labels for multiple parties (e.g., ‘Company A,’ ‘Company B,’ ‘Tenant 1’) and keeps them consistent.

Public Self-Help Users.name: Procedural Posture and Case Stage
Public Self-Help Users.description: Measures how well the summary explains where the case is in the process (e.g., trial, appeal), how it got there, and what was decided procedurally.

sub_criteria.name: Court Level Identified
sub_criteria.description: Identifies the court (e.g., trial court, appellate court, supreme court).

sub_criteria.name: Procedural History Summary
sub_criteria.description: Concisely explains how the case reached this decision (e.g., appeal from dismissal).

sub_criteria.name: Disposition Details
sub_criteria.description: States the procedural outcome (e.g., affirmed, reversed, remanded, dismissed).

sub_criteria.name: Standard of Review Explained
sub_criteria.description: Identifies and briefly explains the standard(s) of review in plain terms (e.g., de novo = fresh look).
accepted_values: 5 - Stated and plainly explained for all major issues
3 - Stated for some issues or weak explanation

sub_criteria.name: Opinion Type and Concurrence/Dissent Noted
sub_criteria.description: Indicates whether the decision is majority, per curiam, plurality, and whether there are concurrences/dissents.
accepted_values: 5 - Opinion type and separate opinions clearly noted

sub_criteria.name: Procedural Vehicle Identified
sub_criteria.description: Names the key procedural mechanisms at issue (e.g., motion to dismiss, summary judgment, injunction, class certification).
accepted_values: 5 - All key vehicles identified and briefly explained

sub_criteria.name: Decision Finality Noted
sub_criteria.description: Clarifies whether the decision is final or interlocutory and any implications for further proceedings.

Public Self-Help Users.name: Key Facts Coverage and Focus
Public Self-Help Users.description: Evaluates whether the summary highlights the material facts necessary to understand the decision and avoids irrelevant details.

sub_criteria.name: Material Facts Included
sub_criteria.description: Includes facts that the court relied on for its decision.

sub_criteria.name: Chronology Clarity
sub_criteria.description: Presents events in a sequence that is easy to follow.

sub_criteria.name: Irrelevant Details Avoided
sub_criteria.description: Minimizes extraneous facts or procedural minutiae that do not affect the outcome.

sub_criteria.name: Quantitative Specifics Included
sub_criteria.description: Includes material numbers/dates/amounts (e.g., damages, timelines) where they matter to the decision.

sub_criteria.name: Disputed vs. Undisputed Facts
sub_criteria.description: Distinguishes facts that are contested from those accepted as true, where relevant to the outcome.

sub_criteria.name: Causality and Materiality Signposting
sub_criteria.description: Signals which facts directly influenced the court’s reasoning or outcome.

Public Self-Help Users.name: Legal Issues Framed
Public Self-Help Users.description: Assesses whether the summary clearly states the legal questions the court addressed in a user-friendly way.

sub_criteria.name: Issue Statements
sub_criteria.description: Identifies each major issue as a focused question or topic.

sub_criteria.name: Type of Issue Distinguished
sub_criteria.description: Indicates whether issues are legal, factual, or procedural when relevant.

sub_criteria.name: User-Friendly Phrasing
sub_criteria.description: Presents issues in plain language (e.g., framed as concise questions laypeople can understand).
accepted_values: 5 - All issues phrased clearly for lay readers

sub_criteria.name: Issue Scope and Sub-Issues
sub_criteria.description: Clarifies the scope of each issue and groups related sub-issues to avoid confusion.

sub_criteria.name: Issue Ordering Reflects Court’s Structure
sub_criteria.description: Orders issues to mirror the court’s presentation, aiding cross-checking and comprehension.

sub_criteria.name: Avoids Compound Questions
sub_criteria.description: Avoids overly broad or multi-part issue statements that obscure analysis.

Public Self-Help Users.name: Rules and Legal Standards Presented
Public Self-Help Users.description: Evaluates whether the summary states the governing rule(s), test(s), or standard(s) the court used and identifies their sources.

sub_criteria.name: Elements or Tests Listed
sub_criteria.description: Lists the elements/steps of the rule or test applied.

sub_criteria.name: Source Identified
sub_criteria.description: Identifies the authority (statute, regulation, case) for the rule.

sub_criteria.name: Exceptions or Defenses
sub_criteria.description: Notes common exceptions, defenses, or limitations if discussed in the case.

sub_criteria.name: Burdens and Standards of Proof
sub_criteria.description: States who bears the burden and the applicable standard (e.g., preponderance, clear and convincing).

sub_criteria.name: Jurisdictional Variations Flagged
sub_criteria.description: Notes if the rule differs by jurisdiction or is specific to the issuing court.

sub_criteria.name: Rule Evolution or Clarification
sub_criteria.description: Indicates whether the case creates, clarifies, narrows, or overrules prior doctrine.

Public Self-Help Users.name: Holding and Outcome Clarity
Public Self-Help Users.description: Measures how clearly the summary states who prevailed and what the court decided on each major issue.

sub_criteria.name: Who Prevailed
sub_criteria.description: Identifies which party won overall and on key issues.

sub_criteria.name: Issue-by-Issue Disposition
sub_criteria.description: States the outcome for each major issue addressed.

sub_criteria.name: Conditional or Alternative Holdings
sub_criteria.description: Identifies conditional rulings or alternative holdings (e.g., in the alternative).

sub_criteria.name: Relief Scope Summarized
sub_criteria.description: Summarizes the scope and limits of relief granted or denied as part of the outcome.

Public Self-Help Users.name: Court’s Reasoning Explained
Public Self-Help Users.description: Assesses whether the summary explains the main reasons the court gave for its decision, in a way a layperson can follow.

sub_criteria.name: Rule-to-Facts Application
sub_criteria.description: Shows how the court applied the rule/test to the specific facts.

sub_criteria.name: Competing Arguments Addressed
sub_criteria.description: Summarizes key arguments and how the court treated them.

sub_criteria.name: Key Factors and Weighting
sub_criteria.description: Highlights the main factors the court considered and their relative importance.

sub_criteria.name: Precedent and Policy Rationale
sub_criteria.description: Explains how precedent and policy considerations influenced the reasoning.

sub_criteria.name: Limiting Principles and Boundaries
sub_criteria.description: Identifies limiting principles the court used to cabin the rule or outcome.

sub_criteria.name: Analogies and Distinctions to Prior Cases
sub_criteria.description: Notes how the court analogized to or distinguished prior authorities in reaching its decision.

Public Self-Help Users.name: Remedies and Orders
Public Self-Help Users.description: Evaluates whether the summary states the practical consequences (e.g., damages, injunctions, fees, sentence) that resulted from the decision.

sub_criteria.name: Remedy Type Identified
sub_criteria.description: Specifies the type(s) of remedy or order (e.g., damages, injunctive relief, declaratory relief, remand).

sub_criteria.name: Specificity and Quantification
sub_criteria.description: States amounts, scope, or terms where available (e.g., dollar figures, scope of injunction).

sub_criteria.name: Timing and Conditions
sub_criteria.description: Notes deadlines, compliance timelines, or conditional aspects of the order.

sub_criteria.name: Fees and Costs
sub_criteria.description: Indicates awards or denials of attorney’s fees, costs, or sanctions if addressed.

sub_criteria.name: Enforcement or Remand Instructions
sub_criteria.description: Describes enforcement mechanisms or remand instructions where relevant.

Public Self-Help Users.name: Practical Implications for Users
Public Self-Help Users.description: Assesses how well the summary explains what the decision means for people in similar situations, in practical terms.

sub_criteria.name: Signals and Takeaways
sub_criteria.description: Identifies indicators of stronger/weaker claims or defenses based on the case.

sub_criteria.name: Real-World Examples
sub_criteria.description: Uses simple examples to illustrate how the ruling might apply.

sub_criteria.name: Risk Flags and Pitfalls
sub_criteria.description: Highlights common mistakes or risks users should avoid in light of the decision.

sub_criteria.name: Mapping to Common Scenarios
sub_criteria.description: Connects the decision to typical user scenarios (e.g., tenant eviction, wage claim) without overgeneralizing.

sub_criteria.name: Role-Specific Implications
sub_criteria.description: Explains how implications may differ for common roles (e.g., employee vs. employer; tenant vs. landlord).

Public Self-Help Users.name: Next-Step Guidance and Options
Public Self-Help Users.description: Evaluates whether the summary offers non-legal-advice guidance on possible steps a user might consider (e.g., information to gather, forms to look for, offices to contact), tied to the case’s lessons.

sub_criteria.name: Action Options
sub_criteria.description: Lists potential actions or choices relevant to the situation (e.g., negotiate, file, seek mediation).

sub_criteria.name: Information to Prepare
sub_criteria.description: Identifies documents or facts users should gather based on the case issues.

sub_criteria.name: Time-Sensitivity Cautions
sub_criteria.description: Flags that deadlines may apply where the case indicates time-sensitive steps.

sub_criteria.name: Resource Referrals
sub_criteria.description: Suggests types of reputable resources (e.g., legal aid, court self-help center) without endorsing specific providers.

sub_criteria.name: Jurisdiction-Specific Pointers
sub_criteria.description: Notes if forms, procedures, or agencies are jurisdiction-specific and advises users to check local requirements.

sub_criteria.name: When to Seek Professional Help
sub_criteria.description: Identifies circumstances where getting legal advice is advisable (without giving legal advice).

sub_criteria.name: Urgent or Safety Considerations
sub_criteria.description: Flags emergency or safety-related steps where the case context warrants (e.g., protective orders, immediate filings).

Public Self-Help Users.name: Applicability and Limitations
Public Self-Help Users.description: Assesses whether the summary notes jurisdiction, scope, and limits so users can gauge if the case likely applies to them.

sub_criteria.name: Jurisdiction Identified
sub_criteria.description: States the jurisdiction or court system for the decision.

sub_criteria.name: Scope and Limits
sub_criteria.description: Explains case-specific limits (e.g., fact-specific, narrow holding) and whether the decision may be persuasive or binding.

sub_criteria.name: Date and Currency Noted
sub_criteria.description: States the decision date or recency to help users assess currency.

sub_criteria.name: Precedential Weight Classification
sub_criteria.description: Classifies the decision’s weight (binding vs. persuasive) within the relevant jurisdiction.

sub_criteria.name: Factual Similarity/Distinguishability
sub_criteria.description: Indicates how fact patterns similar to or different from the case may affect applicability.

sub_criteria.name: Conflicting or Subsequent Authority
sub_criteria.description: Notes known conflicts or subsequent developments that might alter applicability, when mentioned.

sub_criteria.name: Overgeneralization Avoided
sub_criteria.description: Avoids stating the case as a universal rule when the holding is limited.

Public Self-Help Users.name: Organization and Scannability
Public Self-Help Users.description: Evaluates whether the summary is structured for quick understanding with logical sections and visual cues users can scan.

sub_criteria.name: Headings and Sections
sub_criteria.description: Uses descriptive headings and logical sectioning (e.g., Facts, Issues, Holding).

sub_criteria.name: Bullets/Lists for Key Points
sub_criteria.description: Uses bullets or numbered lists to present key items.

sub_criteria.name: Front-Loaded Summary
sub_criteria.description: Provides a brief overview or takeaway at the top.

sub_criteria.name: Navigation Cues and Cross-References
sub_criteria.description: Uses signposting and cross-references to help users find details quickly.

sub_criteria.name: Consistent Party Labels
sub_criteria.description: Uses consistent labels/names for parties throughout to avoid confusion.

Public Self-Help Users.name: Conciseness vs. Completeness
Public Self-Help Users.description: Assesses whether the summary includes enough detail to be useful without overwhelming the reader.

sub_criteria.name: No Unnecessary Detail
sub_criteria.description: Avoids digressions and repetition.

sub_criteria.name: Essential Coverage
sub_criteria.description: Covers all essential elements users need (facts, issues, rules, outcome).

sub_criteria.name: Length Appropriate to Complexity
sub_criteria.description: Keeps the length proportionate to the case’s complexity and user needs.

Public Self-Help Users.name: Neutral Tone and Bias Avoidance
Public Self-Help Users.description: Evaluates whether the summary describes the case objectively without advocacy or moral judgments.

sub_criteria.name: Facts vs. Commentary Distinction
sub_criteria.description: Clearly separates factual description from interpretation or commentary.

sub_criteria.name: Loaded/Emotive Language Avoided
sub_criteria.description: Avoids pejorative or celebratory language that suggests bias.

sub_criteria.name: Balanced Presentation
sub_criteria.description: Represents both parties’ positions fairly when summarizing arguments.

sub_criteria.name: Attribution of Claims
sub_criteria.description: Clearly attributes assertions or interpretations to the appropriate source (party, court, or the summary author).

Public Self-Help Users.name: Citations and Source Transparency
Public Self-Help Users.description: Assesses whether the summary provides the case citation and, where relevant, references to specific portions supporting key points.

sub_criteria.name: Complete Case Citation
sub_criteria.description: Includes case name, reporter, court, and year (or equivalent citation details).

sub_criteria.name: Support for Key Points
sub_criteria.description: Provides references or quotations for critical rules or holdings when appropriate.

sub_criteria.name: Pinpoint or Paragraph References
sub_criteria.description: Uses pinpoint/paragraph citations for precise support where feasible.

sub_criteria.name: Docket and Opinion Metadata
sub_criteria.description: Includes useful metadata when available (e.g., docket number, judge/author, opinion type).

sub_criteria.name: Access Path Provided
sub_criteria.description: Indicates how to locate the source (e.g., public database name or general retrieval guidance).

Public Self-Help Users.name: Disclaimers and Guidance Boundaries
Public Self-Help Users.description: Evaluates whether the summary appropriately states that it is informational and not legal advice and sets realistic expectations.

sub_criteria.name: Not Legal Advice Disclaimer
sub_criteria.description: Explicitly states the content is informational and not legal advice.

sub_criteria.name: No Attorney-Client Relationship
sub_criteria.description: Clarifies that reading the summary does not create an attorney-client relationship.

sub_criteria.name: Jurisdictional/Temporal Limits
sub_criteria.description: Notes that laws vary by jurisdiction and may change over time.

sub_criteria.name: Encouragement to Seek Legal Help
sub_criteria.description: Advises users to seek legal assistance for their specific situation where appropriate.

Public Self-Help Users.name: Uncertainty and Ambiguity Disclosure
Public Self-Help Users.description: Assesses whether the summary openly notes unresolved issues, close questions, or limitations in the court’s reasoning when those are evident from the case.

sub_criteria.name: Dicta vs. Holding Distinction
sub_criteria.description: Indicates which statements are binding holdings versus explanatory dicta when relevant.

sub_criteria.name: Close Questions or Splits Acknowledged
sub_criteria.description: Notes close calls, inter- or intra-jurisdictional splits, or competing interpretations.

sub_criteria.name: Concurring/Dissenting Views Summarized
sub_criteria.description: Briefly summarizes separate opinions when they reveal ambiguity or limits.

sub_criteria.name: Scope of Unresolved Issues
sub_criteria.description: Identifies questions the court left open that affect applicability.

Public Self-Help Users.name: Internal Consistency and Precision
Public Self-Help Users.description: Evaluates whether the summary is self-consistent, avoids speculation presented as fact, and uses precise, calibrated language that matches the limits of the decision—all assessable from the summary itself.

sub_criteria.name: No Internal Contradictions
sub_criteria.description: Avoids contradictions across sections (e.g., parties, facts, outcomes remain consistent).
accepted_values: 3 - Some inconsistencies that cause limited confusion

sub_criteria.name: Speculation and Inference Labeled
sub_criteria.description: Clearly marks inferences or uncertainty (uses conditional language or notes when details are unclear).

sub_criteria.name: Quantitative/Temporal Consistency
sub_criteria.description: Numbers, dates, and timelines are consistent wherever referenced.

sub_criteria.name: Claim Scope Precision
sub_criteria.description: Uses appropriately qualified language (e.g., “in this case,” “in this jurisdiction”) to match the narrowness/breadth of the holding.

Public Self-Help Users.name: Audience and Use-Case Fit
Public Self-Help Users.description: Evaluates alignment with intended user types and contexts, ensuring the summary meets their needs and prior knowledge.

sub_criteria.name: Target User Identification
sub_criteria.description: Clearly indicates or implies who the summary is for (e.g., self-represented litigants, students, journalists).

sub_criteria.name: Assumed Knowledge Appropriate
sub_criteria.description: Assumptions about prior knowledge match the target audience.

sub_criteria.name: Use-Case Contextualization
sub_criteria.description: Ties content to the likely tasks of the target users (e.g., understanding rights, preparing documents).

sub_criteria.name: Language and Cultural Sensitivity
sub_criteria.description: Avoids culturally specific assumptions and uses inclusive, accessible language for diverse audiences.

Public Self-Help Users.name: Substantive Accuracy and Fidelity to Case
Public Self-Help Users.description: Evaluates the faithfulness of the summary to the actual case: facts, rules, outcomes, quotations, and citations.

sub_criteria.name: Outcome Accuracy
sub_criteria.description: Accurately states who prevailed and the disposition (affirmed, reversed, etc.).

sub_criteria.name: Rule/Test Accuracy
sub_criteria.description: Accurately states the governing rule(s), elements, or standards as articulated by the court.

sub_criteria.name: Material Facts Accuracy
sub_criteria.description: Accurately represents the key facts relied on by the court.

sub_criteria.name: Procedural Posture Accuracy
sub_criteria.description: Accurately reflects the case stage, procedural history, and standards of review.

sub_criteria.name: Quotation/Paraphrase Fidelity
sub_criteria.description: Quotes and paraphrases reflect the court’s language and meaning without distortion.

sub_criteria.name: Citation Accuracy
sub_criteria.description: Citations correspond to the correct case and portions of the opinion.

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Structural Schema Compliance
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Assesses whether the summary adheres to an explicit, consistently labeled and ordered section schema that supports deterministic, programmatic parsing.

sub_criteria.name: Section Headings Standardization
sub_criteria.description: Presence and consistency of recognizable section headers (e.g., Metadata, Facts, Issues, Procedural Posture, Holding/Outcome, Reasoning, Citations), using stable spelling and levels.

sub_criteria.name: Section Ordering Consistency
sub_criteria.description: Consistency of section order across summaries to enable deterministic parsing.
accepted_values: Partial (major sections mostly ordered; some swaps)
Consistent (stable global order with rare deviations)

sub_criteria.name: Key-Value Delimiter Consistency
sub_criteria.description: Use of clear, consistent delimiters (e.g., Field: Value) for metadata fields and lists.

sub_criteria.name: Machine-Readable Markers
sub_criteria.description: Use of stable IDs/tags (e.g., field keys, enumerated lists, stable labels) that facilitate automated extraction.

sub_criteria.name: Schema Declaration and Versioning
sub_criteria.description: Explicit schema name/version (e.g., Schema: v1.2) to support long-term compatibility.

sub_criteria.name: Heading Hierarchy and Nesting
sub_criteria.description: Use of hierarchical headings (e.g., H1/H2) or numbering to represent nested structure.

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Text Cleanliness and Encoding Quality
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Evaluates textual hygiene that affects parsing and modeling, including encoding, punctuation, and segmentation.

sub_criteria.name: Unicode/Encoding Normalization
sub_criteria.description: Normalization of quotes, dashes, bullets, and other characters to consistent Unicode forms.

sub_criteria.name: Typographical/OCR Error Rate
sub_criteria.description: Prevalence of typos or OCR artifacts that impede extraction.

sub_criteria.name: Whitespace and List/Punctuation Consistency
sub_criteria.description: Consistent use of spacing, bullet/number formats, and sentence-ending punctuation.

sub_criteria.name: Sentence Boundary Clarity
sub_criteria.description: Sentences are clearly delimited to aid sentence-level tokenization.

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Core Metadata Coverage
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Extent to which essential case metadata needed for large-scale analysis is present.

sub_criteria.name: Jurisdiction Presence
sub_criteria.description: Whether the governing jurisdiction is explicitly stated.

sub_criteria.name: Court Level/Name Presence
sub_criteria.description: Whether the court level/name is stated.

sub_criteria.name: Decision Date Presence
sub_criteria.description: Whether a decision date is provided (format assessed separately).

sub_criteria.name: Case Name/Title Presence
sub_criteria.description: Whether the case name/title is included.

sub_criteria.name: Docket/Citation Presence
sub_criteria.description: Whether a docket number or official citation is included.

sub_criteria.name: Judge/Panel Presence
sub_criteria.description: Whether the authoring judge(s) or panel is identified.

sub_criteria.name: Parties and Roles Presence
sub_criteria.description: Whether principal parties are identified with clear roles (e.g., plaintiff/defendant, appellant/appellee).
accepted_values: Roles Clear (each party mapped to role)

sub_criteria.name: Case Type and Subject Category
sub_criteria.description: Civil/criminal designation and high-level subject category (e.g., contracts, IP).

sub_criteria.name: Publication/Precedential Status
sub_criteria.description: Whether the summary indicates if the case is published/unpublished and precedential/non-precedential.

sub_criteria.name: Neutral Citation Provided
sub_criteria.description: Presence of a neutral-style citation in a parseable format, when provided.

sub_criteria.name: Subsequent History Presence
sub_criteria.description: Whether subsequent history (e.g., rehearing, certiorari, remand) is summarized or indicated.

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Procedural Posture Specificity
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Clarity and detail about the procedural stage and motions at issue.

sub_criteria.name: Stage Identification
sub_criteria.description: Specific procedural stage named (e.g., summary judgment, appeal, remand).

sub_criteria.name: Motion/Relief Identified
sub_criteria.description: Identification of motions or relief at issue (e.g., MTD, MSJ, injunction).

sub_criteria.name: Procedural History Depth
sub_criteria.description: Extent of prior steps and outcomes (trial result, prior appeals).

sub_criteria.name: Standard of Review Stated
sub_criteria.description: Articulation of the standard(s) of review applied.

sub_criteria.name: Disposition Path Clarity
sub_criteria.description: Clarity on how the procedural path led to the disposition (e.g., from MTD to MSJ to appeal).

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Outcome Encoding Clarity
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Explicitness and machine-readiness of the case disposition and per-issue outcomes.

sub_criteria.name: Case-Level Disposition Label
sub_criteria.description: Presence of a standardized, unambiguous overall disposition label (e.g., affirmed, reversed, vacated).

sub_criteria.name: Per-Issue Outcomes
sub_criteria.description: Granularity of outcomes mapped to individual issues/claims.

sub_criteria.name: Remedy/Relief Specification
sub_criteria.description: Details of relief granted/denied (damages amounts, injunction type, remand instructions).
accepted_values: Detailed with Structured Fields (e.g., currency, scope)

sub_criteria.name: Party-Win Mapping
sub_criteria.description: Clear mapping of who prevailed on what (e.g., Appellant wins on Issue 2).

sub_criteria.name: Opinion Split and Concurrence/Dissent
sub_criteria.description: Identification of vote split and presence of concurrences/dissents.

sub_criteria.name: Costs/Fees Awarded
sub_criteria.description: Whether costs, attorney’s fees, or sanctions are addressed and quantified.

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Reasoning Structure Extractability
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Captures whether legal rules/tests and their application are represented in a structured, model-friendly way.

sub_criteria.name: Rule Statement Explicitness
sub_criteria.description: Whether governing rules/standards are explicitly stated.

sub_criteria.name: Test/Prongs Enumeration
sub_criteria.description: Multi-factor tests are enumerated with labeled prongs/steps.

sub_criteria.name: Application-to-Facts Mapping
sub_criteria.description: Each rule/prong is tied to specific facts or findings.

sub_criteria.name: Counterarguments and Distinguishing
sub_criteria.description: Competing arguments addressed and controlling precedents distinguished or reconciled.

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Legal Issue Tagging Granularity
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Presence and specificity of legal issue tags suitable for modeling.

sub_criteria.name: Domain-Level Tagging
sub_criteria.description: High-level subject domains (e.g., torts, contracts) applied.

sub_criteria.name: Specific Issue Tags
sub_criteria.description: Granular, specific issues (e.g., negligence duty, standing, personal jurisdiction).

sub_criteria.name: Hierarchical/Structured Tagging
sub_criteria.description: Use of multi-level taxonomy (domain > topic > issue).

sub_criteria.name: Controlled Vocabulary/Code Mapping
sub_criteria.description: Mapping of tags to a controlled set of codes/IDs (internal or noted system).

sub_criteria.name: Issue-Outcome Linkage
sub_criteria.description: Explicit linkage between issue tags and their outcomes.
accepted_values: Complete (each tagged issue linked to outcome)

sub_criteria.name: Jurisdiction-Specific Tagging
sub_criteria.description: Tags reflect jurisdictional nuances (e.g., state-specific doctrines).

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Citation and Authority Normalization
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Presence and standardization of references to authorities (cases, statutes, regulations) to enable reliable extraction.

sub_criteria.name: Case Citation Format
sub_criteria.description: Conformance to standard reporter/neutral-like formats including year and court where available.

sub_criteria.name: Statute/Regulation Citation Format
sub_criteria.description: Use of recognizable citation formats for statutes/regulations (e.g., title/section).

sub_criteria.name: Pinpoint Citations
sub_criteria.description: Presence of page/paragraph/section pin cites for precise referencing.

sub_criteria.name: Linkability/Identifiers
sub_criteria.description: Inclusion of stable IDs/URLs (e.g., reporter citation, URL, internal ID) for sources.

sub_criteria.name: Precedent Treatment Signals
sub_criteria.description: Use of treatment indicators (e.g., follows, distinguishes, overrules) for cited authorities.

sub_criteria.name: Citation Parentheticals/Explanations
sub_criteria.description: Short parentheticals indicating the cited authority’s relevance/holding.

sub_criteria.name: Subsequent History for Authorities
sub_criteria.description: Indicates subsequent history of key cited authorities (e.g., vacated, affirmed).

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Factual Abstraction and Structure
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Degree to which facts are distilled into structured, extractable elements rather than free narrative only.

sub_criteria.name: Structured Fact Representation
sub_criteria.description: Use of bullet lists, tables, or key-value fields for facts.

sub_criteria.name: Actor-Action-Object Modeling
sub_criteria.description: Facts expressed as tuples with roles/entities and actions.

sub_criteria.name: Temporal Ordering of Facts
sub_criteria.description: Chronologically ordered facts with event markers.

sub_criteria.name: Materiality Emphasis
sub_criteria.description: Distinction between material and background facts.

sub_criteria.name: Quantifiable Fact Capture
sub_criteria.description: Extraction of amounts, counts, and measurable attributes within facts.

sub_criteria.name: Disputed vs Undisputed Facts Labeling
sub_criteria.description: Facts are labeled as disputed/undisputed where relevant (e.g., summary judgment).

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Numerical and Temporal Normalization
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Normalization of dates, monetary amounts, counts, and durations to consistent, machine-readable formats.

sub_criteria.name: Date Format Normalization
sub_criteria.description: Use of ISO-8601 (YYYY-MM-DD) or consistently parseable dates.

sub_criteria.name: Monetary Amount Normalization
sub_criteria.description: Use of explicit currency markers and standardized formats (e.g., USD 1,000,000).

sub_criteria.name: Quantities/Counts Normalization
sub_criteria.description: Consistent representation of counts (e.g., number of claims, parties, citations).

sub_criteria.name: Timeline Events Normalization
sub_criteria.description: Key events expressed with explicit dates or relative times that are parseable.

sub_criteria.name: Durations and Ranges
sub_criteria.description: Durations (e.g., '14 days') and value ranges normalized to consistent units.

sub_criteria.name: Percentages/Rates Normalization
sub_criteria.description: Use of explicit percent/rate formats with denominators where relevant.

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Entity and Role Normalization
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Consistency and clarity in referring to entities using standardized role labels and stable identifiers.

sub_criteria.name: Role Labeling Consistency
sub_criteria.description: Use of standardized roles (e.g., Plaintiff/Defendant; Appellant/Appellee) throughout.

sub_criteria.name: Stable Entity Identifiers
sub_criteria.description: Assignment of stable IDs (e.g., P1, D1) and reuse across sections.
accepted_values: Complete (all key entities have stable IDs)

sub_criteria.name: Alias and Pronoun Resolution
sub_criteria.description: Mapping of aliases and pronouns back to entity IDs/roles.

sub_criteria.name: Entity Typing
sub_criteria.description: Typing of entities (person, organization, government body) where relevant.

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Ambiguity and Hedging Minimization
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Prevalence of hedging language and referential ambiguity that hinders deterministic extraction.

sub_criteria.name: Hedging Language Prevalence
sub_criteria.description: Frequency of hedging terms (e.g., appears, seems, likely) in key sections.

sub_criteria.name: Referential Ambiguity
sub_criteria.description: Use of pronouns or vague references without clear antecedents.

sub_criteria.name: Scope/Qualifier Clarity
sub_criteria.description: Clarity of scope for statements (who/what/when applies).

sub_criteria.name: Modal Verb Precision
sub_criteria.description: Appropriate use of must/shall/should/may to reflect binding rules vs dicta.

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Internal Consistency
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Absence of contradictions across sections (e.g., court level, outcome, party roles) and consistent terminology.

sub_criteria.name: Metadata Consistency
sub_criteria.description: No conflicts in jurisdiction, court, dates, case name, docket/citation across sections.

sub_criteria.name: Outcome Consistency
sub_criteria.description: Disposition labels and narrative conclusions match across sections.

sub_criteria.name: Terminology Consistency
sub_criteria.description: Roles, issue tags, and defined terms used consistently.

sub_criteria.name: Chronological Consistency
sub_criteria.description: No conflicting dates/order of events.

sub_criteria.name: Citation Cross-Section Consistency
sub_criteria.description: Citations referenced in multiple sections remain identical and synchronized.

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Neutrality and Section Separation
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Clear separation of facts, analysis, and outcome without author opinion or advocacy; labels make section purpose explicit.

sub_criteria.name: Opinionated Language
sub_criteria.description: Presence of subjective or evaluative commentary by the summarizer.

sub_criteria.name: Section Purpose Clarity
sub_criteria.description: Facts, analysis, and outcome are labeled and not commingled.

sub_criteria.name: Attribution to Court
sub_criteria.description: Analytical statements clearly attributed to the court’s reasoning rather than the summarizer.

sub_criteria.name: Holding vs Dicta Separation
sub_criteria.description: Holdings are clearly separated from dicta and commentary.

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Extractable Variable Density
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Density of distinct, model-usable variables per 100 words (e.g., outcome label, issues, posture, dates, amounts, roles).

sub_criteria.name: Variable Count per 100 Words
sub_criteria.description: Number of unique extractable variables normalized by length.

sub_criteria.name: Variable Type Breadth
sub_criteria.description: Coverage across categories (metadata, facts, issues, outcomes, citations, quantities).

sub_criteria.name: Redundancy Ratio
sub_criteria.description: Proportion of repeated information vs unique variables.

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Uncertainty and Missing Data Labeling
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Whether unknown or unavailable fields are explicitly marked (e.g., Unknown/Not specified) rather than omitted.

sub_criteria.name: Unknown Token Usage
sub_criteria.description: Explicit use of standardized tokens (e.g., Unknown, Not Provided) where data is missing.

sub_criteria.name: Not Applicable vs Unknown
sub_criteria.description: Differentiates NA from Unknown/Withheld values.

sub_criteria.name: Placeholder Detail
sub_criteria.description: Optional inclusion of rationale or source note for missingness.

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Anonymization and Sensitive Data Handling
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Treatment of personally identifiable or sensitive information to balance privacy with analytical utility.

sub_criteria.name: PII Detection and Redaction
sub_criteria.description: Removal or masking of personal identifiers where appropriate.

sub_criteria.name: Role-Based Substitution
sub_criteria.description: Replacement of names with roles/IDs (e.g., P1, D1) to preserve clarity.

sub_criteria.name: Context-Sensitive Handling
sub_criteria.description: Enhanced protection for minors, medical, or sealed information.

sub_criteria.name: Utility Preservation
sub_criteria.description: Redaction avoids removing essential analytical content.

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Source Anchors and Traceability
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Presence of pinpoint references and internal anchors that allow trace-back to source locations when available, without requiring external verification.

sub_criteria.name: Pinpoint References
sub_criteria.description: Use of paragraph/page/section numbers tied to source.

sub_criteria.name: Stable ID Scheme
sub_criteria.description: Use of stable, systematic anchor IDs or labels within the summary (e.g., Issue[01], Fact[03]).

sub_criteria.name: Quotation Marking and Attribution Format
sub_criteria.description: Quoted material clearly marked with quotation marks and accompanied by a citation/pinpoint when provided.

sub_criteria.name: Cross-Reference Integrity
sub_criteria.description: Internal cross-references (e.g., 'see Issue[02]') resolve correctly and uniquely.

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Length Appropriateness for Modeling
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Overall length relative to typical modeling constraints, balancing coverage with brevity.

sub_criteria.name: Word Count Category
sub_criteria.description: Categorization by total words to meet modeling constraints.

sub_criteria.name: Coverage vs Brevity Balance
sub_criteria.description: Extent to which key elements are covered without unnecessary verbosity.

sub_criteria.name: Section-Level Allocation
sub_criteria.description: Proportionate length across sections (e.g., facts not dwarfing outcome).

sub_criteria.name: Compression Ratio (vs Source)
sub_criteria.description: Approximate summary compression vs source opinion length, when known.

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Multi-Party/Multi-Claim Scalability
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Ability of the summary structure to scale to multiple parties, claims, and issues without loss of clarity.

sub_criteria.name: Issue/Claim ID System
sub_criteria.description: Consistent IDs for issues/claims enabling cross-referencing.

sub_criteria.name: Party-Issue Outcome Matrix
sub_criteria.description: Outcomes expressed per party per issue/claim when applicable.

sub_criteria.name: Scalable Presentation
sub_criteria.description: Use of tables or structured subsections to prevent clutter as counts increase.

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Noise and Boilerplate Minimization
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Degree to which generic boilerplate and non-informative text are minimized to increase signal for modeling.

sub_criteria.name: Boilerplate Proportion
sub_criteria.description: Estimated fraction of boilerplate (generic definitions/disclaimers) in the summary.

sub_criteria.name: Irrelevant Exposition
sub_criteria.description: Presence of narrative content not tied to issues, outcomes, or material facts.

sub_criteria.name: Disclaimer Dominance
sub_criteria.description: Extent to which disclaimers or marketing copy overshadow substantive content.

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Audience and Use-Case Alignment
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Evaluates whether the summary is tailored to declared target user types and common tasks, maximizing end-user utility.

sub_criteria.name: Intended Audience Declaration
sub_criteria.description: Clarity in specifying target users (e.g., litigators, in-house counsel, paralegals, students, researchers).

sub_criteria.name: Use-Case Enumeration
sub_criteria.description: Common tasks listed (e.g., drafting a motion, cite-checking, quick orientation).

sub_criteria.name: Task Coverage Adequacy
sub_criteria.description: Proportion of enumerated tasks that the content directly supports.

sub_criteria.name: Assumed Knowledge Disclosure
sub_criteria.description: Prerequisites and domain assumptions stated (e.g., familiarity with summary judgment standards).

sub_criteria.name: Reading Level Appropriateness
sub_criteria.description: Alignment of prose complexity with target audience (estimated by readability bands).

sub_criteria.name: Navigation to Key Answers
sub_criteria.description: Effort required to find outcome, issues, and standard of review.

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Accuracy and Fidelity to Source
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Measures factual and legal correctness relative to the underlying opinion, and clarity in distinguishing holding from dicta.

sub_criteria.name: Factual Accuracy Error Rate
sub_criteria.description: Major factual inaccuracies per 1,000 words.

sub_criteria.name: Legal Rule/Holding Accuracy
sub_criteria.description: Count of misstatements or reversals of the holding/rule.

sub_criteria.name: Holding vs Dicta Distinction
sub_criteria.description: Explicit labeling and separation of holdings from dicta.

sub_criteria.name: Quote/Paraphrase Fidelity
sub_criteria.description: Accuracy of quoted or paraphrased passages with attribution.

sub_criteria.name: Material Omission Severity
sub_criteria.description: Number of omitted material points that change outcome understanding.

sub_criteria.name: Source Attribution Completeness
sub_criteria.description: Proportion of key propositions tied to a source (case/statute/record).

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Readability and Cognitive Load
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Assesses ease of reading and scanning for end users under time constraints.

sub_criteria.name: Average Sentence Length
sub_criteria.description: Approximate mean sentence length (words/sentence).

sub_criteria.name: Passive Voice Rate
sub_criteria.description: Estimated share of passive-voice sentences.

sub_criteria.name: Jargon Density and Definitions
sub_criteria.description: Specialized terms per 100 words and whether defined on first use or in a glossary.

sub_criteria.name: Scannability Elements
sub_criteria.description: Use of headings, bullets, tables, callouts per 500 words.

sub_criteria.name: TL;DR/Summary Box
sub_criteria.description: Presence and brevity of an upfront 1-3 sentence summary.

sub_criteria.name: Heading Informativeness
sub_criteria.description: Headings communicate key takeaways (e.g., 'Holding: Claim preempted').

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Practical Actionability and Transferability
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Evaluates whether the summary yields actionable guidance for practitioners and clarifies the scope of applicability.

sub_criteria.name: Draft-Ready Rule Statements
sub_criteria.description: Rules distilled into sentences suitable for citation in briefs.

sub_criteria.name: Limitations and Exceptions
sub_criteria.description: Identification of exceptions, carve-outs, and limiting facts.

sub_criteria.name: Transferability Guidance
sub_criteria.description: Clarity on when the rule applies beyond this case (e.g., jurisdiction, fact sensitivity).

sub_criteria.name: Jurisdictional Applicability Flag
sub_criteria.description: Whether binding vs persuasive effect is explicitly flagged for common forums.

sub_criteria.name: Checklist/Workflow Aids
sub_criteria.description: Presence of stepwise checklists or element-by-element flow for application.

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Pedagogical Value (Novice Orientation)
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Utility for students and non-specialists learning doctrinal structure and case analysis.

sub_criteria.name: IRAC/CREAC Structure Presence
sub_criteria.description: Explicit IRAC/CREAC labeling or equivalent learning structure.

sub_criteria.name: Worked Examples/Hypotheticals
sub_criteria.description: Illustrative applications or hypotheticals included.

sub_criteria.name: Term Glossary
sub_criteria.description: Glossary or inline definitions for technical terms and abbreviations.

sub_criteria.name: Key Takeaways/Learning Objectives
sub_criteria.description: Bullet-pointed doctrinal lessons or exam tips.

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Currency and Precedential Context Awareness
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Signals about recency, subsequent history, and weight of authority for end-user reliability.

sub_criteria.name: Subsequent History Noted
sub_criteria.description: Clear note of key subsequent history affecting the case status.

sub_criteria.name: Treatment Signals for This Case
sub_criteria.description: Positive/negative treatment of this case by later authorities summarized.

sub_criteria.name: Jurisdictional Weight
sub_criteria.description: Binding vs persuasive effect stated relative to common forums.

sub_criteria.name: Recency Relevance
sub_criteria.description: Recency flagged relative to fast-evolving domains (e.g., tech, admin law).

Academic & Data-Science Researchers.name: Retrieval and Quick-Glance Features
Academic & Data-Science Researchers.description: Features that enable rapid orientation and search/retrieval by end users.

sub_criteria.name: Keywords/Headnotes Density
sub_criteria.description: Number of concise keywords/headnotes provided.

sub_criteria.name: Key Data Highlights
sub_criteria.description: Visual or textual highlighting of critical fields (holding, SoR, remedy).

sub_criteria.name: Intra-Document Links/Anchors
sub_criteria.description: Clickable anchors or cross-references to sections/issues.
